Sadly, an English medium school in the heart of the town causes traffic chaos as the district administration continues to desist from taking any actions against the school despite several complaints for years to successive district Collectors and other concerned authorities.

"The authorities not only take a lenient view, but also favour the school as their children read in the school," alleged a resident.

The school, St Vincent Convent School, on the Vivekananda Marg, while accommodates over 2,500 students, it creates traffic chaos during school opening and closing hours.

Majority of the students while belong to affluent class and wards of high Government officials, they come to school or go home mainly in four wheelers. The parking of these vehicles on the road that leads to the District Headquarters Hospital, town police station and collectorate, besides connecting banks and insurance companies and other major business establishments creates serious inconveniences for the patients, movement of ambulance and commuters.

More so, there is every possibility of accident because of congestion and movement of tiny children crossing roads from one side to the other.

Traffic officer-in-charge, Prasant Ransigh, however, admitting the fact, said, “ There are lots of complaints against the school. The district Collector has issued an instruction to the school as well as to traffic police which would be enforced within a couple of days and the parking of vehicles near the school won’t be allowed anymore.”

Title: Maoist threat: Tribal family leaves home
Article:
Scared of attack by Maoists, a tribal family of Katuapadar village under Mathili block in Malkangiri district left their home on Tuesday to save their lives.

According to reports, Ganga Madi of the village had allegedly been beaten up by a group of Maoists two days ago on suspicion of being a police informer. The Red rebels conducted a ‘Praja Court’ and thrashed Ganga brutally. They also threatened him of dire consequences if he does not leave the village along with his family.

Fearing further attack, the family abandoned the village. However, no district official could be contacted to comment on the matter till last reports came in.

Notably in October last year, 13 members of a family had left their house at Dabuguda village in the district fearing Maoist threat to their lives.

Title: SC clears way for their appointment
Article:
Buoyed by the positive decision of the Supreme Court (SC), in the guest teachers’ case, the Uttarakhand Government has decided to start the process of recruitment of guest teachers on the vacant posts.

The SC on Tuesday allowed the Uttarakhand government make appointment of guest teachers on vacant posts. Welcoming the decision of the SC, the Education Minister Arvind Pandey told The Pioneer that the decision is positive.

He said that the process of recruitment of guest teachers in the vacant posts would start from Wednesday. The minister said that he was regularly in touch with Attorney General (AG), Mukul Rohatagi on the issue. He said that the education department is committed to provide teachers in all the schools of the state.

It is learnt that recruitment of guest teachers would be done on the basis of district wise merit list. In districts, a committee headed by district magistrates would make appointments of guest faculty.

A stipend of Rs 15000 per month would be paid to the guest teachers and at the time of appointments the candidates would have to submit an undertaking that they would not make any demand for permanent appointments.

More than 5500 posts of LT and Lecturers are at present lying vacant in the government schools of the state. As the process of permanent appointments is time consuming, the state cabinet decided to fill these posts by guest faculty as an immediate though temporary measure to provide teachers in schools.

However some of the former guest teachers challenged the drive in the SC which issued a stay on the appointment of guest teachers. The issue was pending before the SC since then.

Last year, the hearing of the case was delayed as the case earlier was listed in the court of then Chief Justice of India (CJI), Ranjan Gogoi. However the case could not come up for hearing as the constitutional bench of SC consisting of five judges headed CJI was engaged in a day to day hearing of the politically sensitive Ramjanambhoomi- Babri Masjid land dispute case. After the superannuation of CJI, Gagoi, the case came up for hearing in another bench of SC which gave its verdict on Tuesday.

Title: CM launches mobile app of CSSDA
Article:
Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday launched ‘Rojgar Sangi’, a mobile app of state-run Chhattisgarh State Skill Development Authority at the concluding function of youth fest held here at Science College premises.

CSSDA has prepared the app in a bid to provide employment to the trained youths under their skill development programme.

The app will serve as a bridge between employment provider and the trained youth and the former could contact them as per their requirements. This will also provide options of job to the trained youth and they could also be able to choose their employer as per their skill and choice.

Official sources informed that information of trained youths from more than 400 courses have been incorporated in the app and any of the employment company or any individual could post his vacancy in the app.

Title: Those backstabbing party cannot be referred to as Taksalis: Sukhbir
Article:
Launching a frontal attack on the Dhindsa father-son duo, the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) president Sukhbir Badal on Tuesday minced no words to say that those backstabbing the party cannot be referred to as Taksalis (traditional Akalis).

“Those, like MP Sukhdev Singh Dhindsa, who are backstabbing the mother party, which has given them so much honour, could not be referred to as Taksalis as they are trying to weaken the panth,” said Sukhbir, addressing a massive congregation while paying rich tributes to the 40 ‘Muktas’ who sacrificed themselves for the ‘kaum’.

Sukhbir said: “A Taksali is someone who is loyal to his party and never disobeys it.”“Sukhdev Singh Dhindsa lost all elections but one in the last 35 years, but he was consistently accommodated by Parkash Singh Badal by being made chairman of a State Board or given a Rajya Sabha ticket. This happened even when he lost by a margin of three lakh votes. SAD and Sardar Badal were not bad for him then,” said Sukhbir.Stating that Dhindsa was questioning SAD’s contribution towards the panth and Punjab by stating that he wanted to free the SAD of the Badals, he said that Sardar Badal was known for his service to the people.“In public service it is the people who decided the fate of their leaders.The people have reposed their faith in Badal Sahab on numerous occasions and he has been winning elections since 1965 and is also a five-time chief minister. In direct contrast, those who are not liked by the people, face defeat in repeated elections,” said Sukhbir.Speaking about former minister and party MLA Parminder Singh Dhindsa, SAD president said that he was like a younger brother to him. “I have always tried to accommodate him. He came to me to change his constituency. I agreed. Sukhdev Dhindsa requested for a ticket for his bureaucrat son-in-law from Mohali.I agreed to that too. It pains me that they are calling me a dictator now. They did not earlier,” he said.

Speaking about his own conduct, Sukhbir said that Sukhdev Dhindsa is my elder. “I touch his feet.

I have played in his lap. I also know, as a fact from my 35 years in politics, that Badal Sahab never said no to Dhindsa. Despite this, Dhindsa has now made it his aim to take on the Badal family. I want to tell him that we won’t win or lose as per your will but by the will of the people,” he added.Also taking on the Punjab Government and the Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh on the burning issues of the State, Sukhbir said that the people had been burdened with unbearable tariff hikes which had affected each and every person and was making the industry unviable.SAD president accused the Chief Minister of releasing fake advertisements saying that the Government had created 10 lakh jobs. Stating that rule of the jungle was prevalent during Congress rule, he said that the Congress Ministers and MLAs were using gangsters to terrorize their political opponents as well as the common man.

Title: Min reviews NMDC’s performance
Article:
Union Minister of State for Steel Faggan Singh Kulaste visited the head office of NMDC Limited at Hyderabad on Tuesday. The Minister met CMD, Directors, CVO and Senior Officials of the company and reviewed NMDC’s performance.

Kulaste said, NMDC is one of the largest mining companies in India that has been the backbone of steel industry ensuring raw material security to steel producers. He appreciated NMDC’s efforts for carrying out sustainable and responsible mining.

The Minister also enquired about renewal position of Diamond Mining Project, Panna and congratulated NMDC for its CSR initiatives.

Earlier NMDC CMD, N. Baijendra Kumar welcomed the Minister and stated that this is the first visit of Kulaste to NMDC head office and also apprised the Minister about NMDC’s performance, progress of ongoing projects and assured that best efforts are put to enhance production and productivity.

Title: InBriefs
Article:
Punjab Vidhan Sabha special session on Jan 16

Chandigarh: Punjab Governor VP Singh Badnore has summoned the tenth (special) session of 15th Punjab Vidhan Sabha at 11 am instead of 10 am on January 16, 2020. Vidhan Sabha’s official spokesperson said that earlier the timing of the session was scheduled at 10 am. Now, the Governor has summoned the 10th (special) session on January 16, 2020 (Thursday), at 11 am in Punjab Vidhan Sabha Hall, Vidhan Bhavan, Chandigarh.

MCC to hold Lohri & Makar Sakranti in sec 17

Chandigarh: The Municipal Corporation Chandigarh has decided to organize Lohri & Makar Sakranti programme in Sector 17, Plaza on January 15 from 4.00 pm onwards.Raj Bala Malik, Mayor, Chandigarh said that preparations have been done with great zeal and enthusiasm for the event. Chief Guest for the event will be local MP Kirron Kher. All the councillors and Market Welfare Associations of the city especially sector 17 and Chandigarh Beyopar Mandal have been invited for the event.

Haryana promotes five officials of IPRL Dept

Chandigarh: Haryana Government has promoted five officials of Information, Public Relations and Languages Department with immediate effect. Among those who have been promoted include Production in-charge Ravinder Kumar promoted as Deputy Superintendent, Press Facility Assistant Kuldeep Rathi promoted as Production in-charge, Sales Manager Jot Ram as Press Facility Assistant, Assistant Ravinder Singh as Sales Manager and Assistant Ramesh Chander has been promoted as cashier.

Punjab announces rotational irrigation prog

Chandigarh: Punjab Water Resources Department on Tuesday announced rotational programme of canals for irrigation in the Rabi season from January 15 to 22, 2020. The channels and branches, off-taking from Ropar head works, would run on priority basis from Sidhwan Branch, Bathinda Branch, Bist Doab Canal, Patiala Feeder and Abohar Branch respectively. Spokesperson said that direct distributaries of Bhakra Main Line (BML) in Group A, being in the channels of first preference, will run to their indent, and the balance water available would be utilized in Ghaggar branch and Patiala minor in Group B respectively.

Title: 3,000 cops deployed for Makar Sankranti
Article:
Administration is all set for a peaceful Makar Sankranti with elaborate security arrangements. The district police have deployed more than 3,000 police force along with around 200 women cops at different places during Makar Sankranti and Tusu festivity at different places of the city on January 15.

East Singhbhum SSP Anoop Birtharay said that they are deploying large number of police personnel at Domuhani which would witness a fair and also along the river banks. All the thana OCs have been directed to increase vigil along approach roads to major ghats and also to picnic spots as people will also throng picnic spots.

Significantly, fairs would be organised to mark Tusu festivity at Domuhani (the largest fair in the region), Bhillaipahari, Ghaghidih, Parsudih and even in Ghatshila drawing thousands of tribals on Wednesday.

Special vigil would also be held at crowded places which witness cockfights to avoid any law and order situation. For those office going professionals who avoid street food and prefer to binge at eateries inside the market areas will have to compromise.

The tribals in and around the city are gearing up to celebrate Tusu, the harvest festival, with traditional fanfare and gaiety. Various social and cultural organisations are set to organise Tusu Mahotsav at places like Domuhani, Sonari (the meeting point of Subarnarekha and Kharkai) and Itagarh.

Hundreds of people, especially tribals, would assemble there to take part in the annual celebrations. Various tribal groups would carry the idol of Goddess Tusu for immersion. The mela at Sonari, one of the oldest in the city, draws the maximum crowd. It is famous for organising traditional events with festivities.

"Melas are a traditional part of Tusu. It is organised with an aim to bring the traditional tribal culture and tribal artisans to the limelight. We have also planned a number of contests during the mela," said an official, organising committee, Tusu Mela Samiti, Itagarh.

The annual Tusu mela at Gopal Maidan also turns out to be a jamboree of tribal artistes and performers not only from Jharkhand but also from neighbouring states like Odisha and Bengal.

People start flocking in groups from the morning carrying their Tusu idols and the choudal. The annual mela that is organised by Jharkhand Ekta Manch at Gopal Maidan is also one of the most sought after fair. People from different places came to the Tusu mela in large numbers.

Title: US Consul General addresses entrepreneurs
Article:
Patti Hoffman, Consul General, US Consulate General Kolkata addressed a session organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce (IACC), Eastern Region at a city hotel.

In her address, Hoffman mentioned that, she was extremely happy to be in Jamshedpur, a leading manufacturing hub in eastern India, with a long history of collaboration between companies based here and technology providers in the United States. She said, “The Steel City is home to significant U.S. investments and over the next two days she looked forward to visiting US linked companies like Cummins India Limited and Timken India Limited to learn more about their manufacturing operations here. She also looked forward to visiting India’s largest automobile manufacturer Tata Motors Limited, that too has leveraged U.S. technology to become a leading global company.”

Hoffman also said that, “The United States is strengthening and deepening partnerships with countries like India that share American values. As vibrant democracies rooted in shared values, cultures of entrepreneurship, and leadership positions on the global stage, the United States and India are natural strategic partners. The United States and India, along with other like-minded countries share a vision for South Asia and the broader Indo-Pacific of a free, open, and rules-based societies. The U.S.-India trade and investment relationship is a key pillar of the Indo-Pacific vision of the United States.”

Title: Solid waste management in shambles in Bokaro
Article:
Cleanness drive seems to have failed to leave a mark in Bokaro with several nooks and corners found chunked with garbage and solid waste across the steel city Bokaro. Pick-up of garbage and waste is stopped for the past 45 days. City has a population over 6 lakhs, and Bokaro Steel Plant (BSL) management has the primary responsibility of cleaning the township area.

In the middle of the bad odour rising from the waste, the residents are forced to reside. We are finding a very hard time, said Poonam Sinha, a housewife and a resident of Sector 3. “The situation would become more frightening if the lifting of waste will not start soon,” she added.

Another resident Vinod Kumar said, if the situation persists few more days the population may come in the grip of several diseases. “It is estimated that more than 3000 tonnes of garbage is lying in various sectors of the city in past one month, spreading bad smells as well as germs in our locality,” added Kumar.

About 80 tonnes of garbage is increasing day-by-day which was getting dumped at different areas, nooks and corners in the township areas. The Public Health Department of BSL in the township is responsible for the pickup and disposal of waste, an official said requesting anonymity.

In the year 2017, BSL outsourced this work to M/S Utility Powertech Limited for one and a half years for Rs 6.5 crores and the company started a door-to-door collection of waste from various sectors and used to dump near Sector 11 in the landfill site, said the official.

After the successful completion of the work, the tender of this company was extended till 30 November 2019 and after that tender yet to be finalized and thus work is being hampered. It resulted into increase in the heaps of garbage across the township areas, he said.

Notably, Utility Powertech Limited is a joint venture of NTPC and Reliance and stopped their work after the contract was over. Although the tender was signed by BSL before the contract was over, four-five parties participated but it was not yet finalized, another official said.

Expressing deep concern over the dumping of bio-medical waste and garbage in the township area and increasing health hazard situation Dhanbad MP P N Singh assured to resolve the issue earliest. “I will talk personally to the senior officials of Bokaro Steel Management at an early date in this regard,” said MP.

Title: Cash of Rs 11L, gold looted in K’handi
Article:
Armed miscreants looted cash and valuables from a house at gunpoint in the Jaipatna area of Kalahandi district late on Monday night.

Reports said four to five masked miscreants barged into the house of one Sourabh Jain at Bhairipali village under the Jaipatna police station and thrashed the family members with iron rods.

Then they terrorised the family members at gunpoint and decamped with the cash of Rs 11 lakh and 300 gram gold ornaments.

On being informed about the loot, police including Kalahandi SP Battula Gangadhar reached the spot on Tuesday morning and started investigation.

Efforts are on to trace and nab the looters, police sources said. The armed loot has triggered panic among the residents of the area.

Title: Students have to pass Class-XI exam for 2nd yr
Article:
As a reform measure in the education sector, the State Government has asked all higher secondary schools (Plus Two colleges) to conduct annual examination for Class-XI students to get promoted to Class-XII from the current academic year.

The Directorate of Higher Secondary Education (DHSE) wrote to Principals of such schools to hold annual examination for Class-XI students in the second fortnight of February each year. The examination would be conducted in the CHSE, Odisha pattern covering the full course of Class-XI.

Title: Paddy procurement stopped; Balangir farmers suffer
Article:
Balangir farmers are facing a big problem due to sudden stoppage of purchase of their paddy as the target given by the Government to the district has been achieved.

Other factors like lack of adequate infrastructure to purchase paddy at Primary Agricultural Cooperative Society (PACS), irregularities in issue of token to farmers at the State level and deduction of at least 5kg per bag of paddy in the name of Fair Average Quality (FAQ) ,which is popularly known as " Katni and Chhatni" too have overshadowed the paddy procurement in the district. Balangir district was given a target of 19 lakh tonnes. This year, the district has a good paddy production. As a result, the target given by the Government was achieved by December 28 last.

Consequently, the farmers who are yet to dispose of their paddy are waiting.

BJP district president Sibaji Mohanty told mediapersons that the party had submitted a memorandum to the district administration to take remedial measures in this regard.

"Let the Government purchase paddy from farmers without further delay, besides improving infrastructure at PACS level," demanded Mohanty. He also demanded issue of P pass system at the PACS level, rather than at the State level.

"We are getting reports that additional seven lakh metric tons of paddy procurement target has been allocated to Balangir district. But the Balangir district administration is issuing target to PACS arbitrarily. While some PACS are getting higher target,other PACS are getting less. We demand an inquiry into this. Moreover, the millers are also purchasing paddy from farmers, contrary to High Court order," Mohanty alleged.

In a related development, Loisingha MLA Mukesh Mahaling, BJP leader Pradeep Purohit and others on Tuesday staged a demonstration before the collectorate here, protesting against the deduction of five to seven kg of paddy from the farmers at PACS level, saying it did not conform with FAQ standard set by the Government.

Besides, farmers of Nagaon(B) of and Bidighat led by Zilla Krushak Mahasangh president Sudhir Parischha on Tuesday staged a demonstration before the Civil Supplies office, demanding purchase of their paddy and transparency in procurement at PACS level. Their dharna was withdrawn after the authorities assured to take measures.

"If remedial action is not taken within seven days, the farmers would gherao the office once again," threatened Parischha.

Title: 4.79 kg ganja seized in U'kote
Article:
A team of Excise personnel of Nabarangpur district raided house of one Dulal Mazumdar of Murtuma village under Umerkote police limits and recovered 4.79 kg of ganja in presence of Executive Magistrate Subash Chandra Singh.

Later, the Excise sleuths seized the ganja, arrested the accused and forwarded him to court on Tuesday. District Superintendent of police, Excise Pradeep Patnaik told the ganja was brought from Malkanagiri and the accused was to send it to Bilaspur of neighbouring Chattisgarh for commercial purpose. The market value of the seized ganja is over Rs 30 lakh, Patnaik said. Meanwhile, the accused was sent to judicial custody after rejection of his bail plea.

Title: Social media orientation held
Article:
A youth orientation programme on use of social media for social transformation was held by the District Press Club (DPC) of Nuapada at Khariar on Tuesday.

Fifteen young social activists of Khariar, Komna, Sinapali and Boden blocks of the district, who are working at the grassroots level to help poor deprived and marginalised people to get their rights, participated in the orientation.

"In addition to train them on use of social media to focus on problems, we also trained the youths about relevance of collecting detailed information on issues/ problems, which they are trying to focus," said DPC treasurer Parameswar Barik. DPC president Ajit Panda, secretary Tapan Dash and other membersKunal Behera and Kshirasindhu Sagaria were present.

Title: Brahmapur students make low-cost e-cycle
Article:
Director of Indian Institute Science Education and Research (IISER) KVR Chary has unveiled an e-cycle designed and developed by a group of students of Fitter Trade of IIT, Brahmapur.

Director Chary in his address hailed the efforts and innovative ideas of the students. He said the cycle would cater to the needs of the middle class and lower middle class people.

The present generation people are facing a rapid increase in environmental pollution coupled with manifold increase in fuel price. Hence, the e-cycle would be able to mitigate these problems, he added.

Though the market price of the e-cycle would be Rs 20,000, but the one developed by the students could come at a cost of Rs 6,000.

While designing the e-cycle, the students have kept in mind not only the cost, but also the emerging pollution and security of the youth mass, claimed Principal of ITI Dr Rajat Kumar Panigrahi.

Once charged, the cycle can run up to 25 km and when battery is exhausted, one can easily paddle it like a normal cycle to reach the destination, he said.

The cycle was designed and developed by a team of three brillian students, namely, Aditya Sahu (Fitter), Narayan Sethi (Fitter) and T. Srinivas Rao (Fitter) under the technical supervision of Gayachand Sahu, Instructor, sources said.

Title: ‘NTPC Kaniha implements RAA initiative in schools
Article:
: With the aim to promote and encourage students in learning Science and Mathematics, the NTPC Talcher Kaniha under its CSR initiative is supporting the Rashtriya Avishkar Abhiyan (RAA) which aims to inculcate curiosity and creativity among students in the areas of science and mathematics.

NTPC Talcher Kaniha is actively implementing the one year long initiative in 10 Upper Primary schools around the station.

The hardware and learning resource kits will be provided by the Unit of Science and Educational Development (UNISED) in these 10 identified schools and will be equipped with solar power operated audio-visual system (smart classrooms) to provide an enhanced learning environment in Class-VI, VII and VIII.

Various learning tools, supplementary resource material, science and mathematics kits along with laboratories will be provided to the students.

Title: MP Tourism Board, CII to hold series of interactive session
Article:
With an objective to promote Madhya Pradesh Tourism Policy and opportunities available with the Tourism Department in the form of land parcel and heritage properties on lease, MP Tourism Board, in partnership with Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) is organising a series of Interactive session across seven cities of country.

In this series, the inaugural meet was organised on Monday at Minto Hall, Bhopal, department has planned other meets in cities like Jabalpur, Indore, Delhi, Mumbai, Agra & Bengaluru.

Faiz Ahmed Kidwai, Managing Director, MP Tourism Board addressed the session at Bhopal and briefed the participating delegates on the efforts being made to develop tourism sector in Madhya Pradesh State.

He added that MP is a State of immense tourism potential and investors should take advantage of this potential, and invited industries to invest in Tourism sector of Madhya Pradesh State and assured for all the help from ‘MP Tourism Board’.

AK Rajoria, Director, MP Tourism Board made a presentation and enlightened the gathering about various incentives and subsidies available to investors for investing in tourism industry of Madhya Pradesh and the different initiatives of ‘MP Tourism Board’ for supporting investors to develop tourism industry in the state.

Session was followed by a round of question & answers where-in the team of MP Tourism Board including Bhawna Walimbe, Additional Managing Director, MP Tourism Board, AK Rajoria, Director, MP Tourism Board, Manoj Singh, Director, MP Tourism Board, Ram

Kumar Tiwari, Deputy Director, MP Tourism Board & Suresh Jhariya, Joint Director, MP tourism Board addressed different queries of delegates. Meet received an overwhelming response of more than 130 investors from different sectors of industry including Hotel Chain owners, Real Estate Developers, CA’s, Tours & Travel Operators.

Title: Rawat reiterates Govt’s intention after Guv approves Char Dham Bill
Article:
With the Raj Bhawan granting its approval to the Char Dham Devsthanam Management Bill, the Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat clarified that the management of the Char Dham shrines and nearby temples will be under the Char Dham Devstahanam Management Board but the traditional rights of the priests and other stakeholders will remain unaffected.

After being passed in the Vidhan Sabha last year, the Char Dham Devsthanam Management Bill was sent to the Raj Bhawan for clearance. The governor recently gave her approval to the Bill.

Talking to media persons on Tuesday after this development, the chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat said that with this, the management of Badrinath, Kedarnath, Gangotri, Yamunotri and some other shrines will be handled by the Char Dham Devsthanam Management Board.

However, the rights and traditional practices related to the priests, Teerth Purohits, Haqhakookdharis and other stakeholders will not be affected by this. Rawat further said that there is a reaction whenever some improvement is made.

The rights of the Teerth Purohits will be kept secure. The chief minister further said that Hindu devotees from across the nation and abroad wish to visit the Char Dham and other religious sites in Uttarakhand which is known for its good hospitality.

The Char Dham Devsthanam Management bill was brought in order to ensure better facilities for the devotees from around the nation and abroad arriving at the Char Dham shrines and other religious places in the state, he added.It will be recalled that after the bill was passed in the winter session of the Assembly during December last year, there were objections and protests from a segment of the stakeholders connected to Char Dham and other shrines. They were of the opinion that altering the management of system of shrines would affect their traditional rights and privileges.

However, the State Government has repeatedly stressed that new management board will improve facilitation without affecting the traditional rights of stakeholders.

Title: Health department gears up to take on swine flu
Article:
The health department of provisional State capital is gearing itself to tackle swine flu which raises its head during winters. Though no case of swine flu has been reported yet in Dehradun district, the district health department is claiming that it has taken adequate measures to combat the disease.

The chief medical officer (CMO) of Dehradun, Dr Meenakshi Joshi told The Pioneer that all the hospitals have adequate stock of the swine flu medicine and triple layer masks.

She added that the department is also making new purchase of masks and medicine. The CMO said that all the hospitals have been asked to reserve one ward each for the suspected patients of the disease.

The department sends the swab samples of the suspected patients of the disease to the laboratory of National Centre of Disease Control (NCDC), New Delhi for testing. Recently the health has also decided to give credit to the swine flu report of Mahant Indiresh Hospital.

Swine flu is a viral disease, its virus is also called H1 N1 and its genetic analysis has shown that it has originated from the animals specially pigs hence it is called Swine flu. The swine flu patients are divided into three categories.

In 'A' category patient suffers from mild fever and irritation in throat. The patients of this category should be isolated at home and require no test or medication. The patients of 'B' category are characterised by high fever and the patient need isolation and should be administered Oseltamivir (Tami flu) medicine.

The medical experts are of the view that if a patient is suffering from breathlessness, low Blood Pressure along with symptoms of A and B category than he is put under category 'C'. Such patients should be isolated, hospitalised, should be administered Tami flu and needed to be tested for swine flu.

Title: Livestock looter gang busted in Ganjam
Article:
The Bhanjanagar police in Ganjam district have arrested six members of a livestock looter gang and rescued as many as 151 goats and sheep.

“The gang used to loot goats and sheep from sheds by threatening the rearers with sharp weapons in Ganjam and other neighbouring districts. We have arrested six members of the gang and efforts are on to apprehend others involved in the offence. The arrestees are natives of Jatni and used to sell the animals in the area after committing loot,” a police official said on Tuesday.

A SUV, swords and mobile phones were seized from their possession. The rescued animals would be handed over to the rearers, he added.

Worth mentioning, the gang while looting goats at Baragaon village under Jagannathprasad station in Ganjam district on January 9 had abandoned an SUV before fleeing from the spot.

Title: BRMGSS submits memo, seeks amenities
Article:
The Bharatiya Railway Mal Godam Shramik Sangh (BRMGSS), Odisha branch, led by its general secretary T Ramesh Kumar Rao gave a memorandum to the General Manager, East cost Railway Zone (Bhubaneswar) here seeking basic amenities of the labourers such as drinking water, toilets, resting and bathing facilities.

On October 28, 2003, a meeting was held under the chairmanship of former Union Labour Minister Dr Sahib Sing in New Delhi regarding the matter and it had been decided to provide the basic need of the labourers.

After that on May 25, 2004 Deputy Director, Traffic commercial (Rates) Railway Board, issued a letter to all General Managers, Indian Railway, regarding the implementation of the decision on facilities. In this connection on August 4, 2017, Minister of State, Railways, Rajen Gohain also issued an order to provide the facilities.

However, despite all this, the labourers have been deprived of the facilities since 2004, alleged the BRMGSS.

Title: K'jhar NH work lapses: Mishaps frequent
Article:
Frequent accidents have been occuring on NH- 520 from Rimuli to Bhadrasahi in Keonjhar district causing loss of valuable lives and property of locals.

Though it is more than one and a half years since the construction of the expansion of the NH has started but due to slow pace of the work by Montecarlo - the contract agency, there is not much headway in the work. Consequently, the public is at the receiving end.

Coupled with the traffic problem, poor quality of work by the contractor is adding to the woes of the locals as bad roads are causing accidents daily. As per rules, a contractor has to make bypass road for temporary use by the commuters when main roads are constructed but here in 520- NH, all rules are thrown to wind.

On Sunday, one Kishore Gadnayak (35) working as staff in Jio company died on the spot at Karansahi under Joda police station in a bike accident. Similarly, on January 2, two bikers had died at Kandra.

Departmental officers are passing by daily on the road but everyone is mum over lapses by the contractor. The locals demanded immediate intervention of higher authorities.

Title: Filmmaker Mahapatra cremated at Puri
Article:
Mortal remains of eminent filmmaker Manmohan Mahapatra, who died on Monday at the age 69, were consigned to flames with state honour at the Swargadwar here on Tuesday morning.

The last rites of Mahapatra, Odisha’s first new-wave film director, were performed after a guard of honour was given by police. Apart from his relatives, noted personalities from Ollywood were present at the crematorium to pay their last respects to him.

Mahapatra had won as many as eight consecutive national awards for his films. Some of his critically-acclaimed films are ‘Nishita Swapna’, ‘Majhi Pahacha’, ‘Tired Afternoon’, ‘Neeraba Jhada’, ‘Seeta Raati’ and ‘Bhinna Samaya’.

Title: 4 RPF personnel suspended in rice theft case
Article:
Four Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel were placed under suspension on Tuesday for their alleged involvement in loot of huge stocks of rice from a freight train in the district.

RPF DG has suspended the four officials, Inspector LN Das, ASI SK Kumar and Havildars RV Thakur and D Baxala on charges of dereliction of duty after a probe into the theft.

According to sources, 288 bags of rice of the Odisha State Civil Supplies Corporation Limited were being transported to Ranchi from Bargarh in a goods train when it was looted on January 8 night.

After the loot, the rice packets were reportedly kept in an abandoned godown in Doubling Colony near the Jharsuguda Railway Station.

Acting on a tipoff, the Goverernment Railway Police had recovered the rice from the house and arrested three persons identified as Rahul Sahu, Krishna Sahu and Tinku Kanta. They were produced in a court on Monday.

Title: District Court orders 1 year imprisonment in power theft
Article: The District Court has pronounced a verdict of One year imprisonment and a fine of Rs 1,09,405 in case of power theft by Israel Qureshi, a resident of Labour Colony, Indrapuri, Nizamuddin Road under the Bhopal City Circle, Anand Nagar Zone of Madhya Kshetra Vidyut Vitran Company. It is to be mentioned that the case was registered by the inspection team of the power distribution company against Israel Qureshi for stealing electricity by connecting direct wires from the LT line for his Ayan A-One chicken shop on June 14, 2016. The case was presented by the company before the Special Judge (Electricity) in the District Court of Bhopal.

Title: LIC Bhopal celebrates World Hindi Day
Article:
The Life Insurance Corporation of India Central Zonal Office Bhopal observed World Hindi Day on January 10, 2020.

Regional Manager (Estate and HRD) Yogendra Singh said efforts should be made to maximise the usage of Hindi in all day-to-day work similarly inspiring others to learn Hindi and shared importance of Hindi language and explained importance of Hindi in corporation.

On the occasion concerned officials and employees of all departments who are involved in preparing quarterly implementation report in Hindi participated to encourage use of Hindi in various departments and correct and timely submission of report could be done.

The participating concerned officials and employees of all departments shared their views and discussed on better usage with efficiency. Poetry recital session was organised by the participating concerned officials and employees.

Singh said that selection of easier words in official usage should be made so that more work could be done in Hindi.

He emphasised that training on Hindi language could be done across all the departments and make more use of Hindi which could make Central Zone an important place across LIC for works done in Hindi.

Regional Manager Devraj Tandi said that our zone is ‘K’ in perspective of Hindi and to maintain this, efforts should be made to work in Hindi completely at all levels.

On the occasion Vatsalya Modh, Shirpati Verma, Arun Rathod, Sushil Giri shared their views and experience while working with Hindi in different works and encouraged the use of Hindi. The convener of the programme was Rajbhasa Officer Chandrashekhar Taapi.

Title: Ceramic art camp ‘Aakar' held
Article:
The Ceramic art camp 'Aakar' being held in Madhya Pradesh State Tribal Museum is evoking a wonderful response by the artists.

The camp is being organised by Tribal Folk Arts and Languages Development Academy, Madhya Pradesh Culture Council.

Every day new toys are created in the craftsmanship of the craftsmen in the organised camp of 'Aakar'. The camp is very helpful in children's development as well as in female development.

The specialty of these toys made of clay is that any item kept in the house is prepared by the craftsman and presents it for the children to play, so that they also understand what this object is used for.

This curiosity effort is appreciated and the atmosphere becomes happy.

The craftsman from Chhattisgarh, Sahadeva Rana, decorated the toys used in the traditional festival in his toys. In the traditional dance performed by the Madia tribe after harvest.

They decorated the feathers of the particular birds on the head and showed the mask of a man and woman dancing in the clay, in their toys, their toys include cow, ox, monkey, peacock. Parrot, household utensils.

Title: City witnesses brief rain
Article:
Heavy showers for a brief period in the State capital were witnessed during the day on Tuesday; abrupt changes made weather conditions cold and later effect faded away.

Normal weather conditions prevailed during the day after bright sun light making day temperatures over 26 degree Celsius on Monday and on Tuesday few heavy spell was witnessed in the morning and evening. The abrupt change brought cold conditions for sometime but later day temperature rose to normal levels.

Among the nearby areas Raisen recorded 8.2 degree Celsius. The day temperatures witnessed significant increase providing relief from harsh cold conditions.

The State capital would witness partial cloudy conditions and is likely to witness light showers. The day and night temperatures would be recorded around 24 and 13 degree Celsius.

The lowest night temperature was recorded at 7 degree Celsius in Betul. Damoh and Mandla recorded day temperature at 29 degree Celsius while Hoshangabad and Khargone recorded day temperature at 28.1 and 28.5 degree Celsius.

In Bhopal, Indore, Gwalior and Chambal divisions witnessed foggy conditions. Day temperatures witnessed significant increase in Shahdol, Bhopal and Ujjain divisions.

Thunder lightening activities and foggy conditions would be witnessed in the next 24 hours according to the warning issued by Met department.

The regions which are likely to witness thunder lightening activities are Bhopal division and Guna, Ashok Nagar, Khandwa, Dhar, Indore, Ujjain and Dewas districts.

Warning of moderate to dense fog has been issued for Gwalior, Chambal, Sagar divisions and Bhopal, Indore, Ujjain, Ratlam and Shajapur districts.

Title: PGCMDM course in AIIMS Bhopal
Article:
Post Graduate Certificate Course in Medical Management of CBRNE Disasters (PGCMDM) programme’ has been inaugurated on 10th January, 2020 at AIIMS, Bhopal by Prof YK Gupta, President, All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Bhopal in the presence of Prof Sarman Singh, Director, AIIMS, Bhopal.

Along with AIIMS, Bhopal, the course has been started simultaneously in three other Learner Support Centers in collaboration with Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU) and Institute of Nuclear Medicine and Allied Sciences (INMAS), Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO).

It is a six-month PG Certificate Course programme in the Medical Management of CBRNE disasters through open and distance learning for MBBS doctors. The 6-month course will have contact duration of 15 days, 10 days at INMAS and 5 days at Learner Support Centre (AIIMS, Bhopal).CBRNE disaster implies Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear and Explosives.

It is for the first time that such a course in CBRNE Disaster Management is initiated in the country. Information about the course is available on the website of AIIMS, Bhopal (www.aiimsbhopal.edu.in) under the head of ‘IGNOU Regional Center’. Registration for the course is now open.

For details and applying online, please visit: www.ignou.ac.in.

Title: Armed Forces Veterans Day celebrated in city
Article:
The Nation celebrated the Armed Forces Veterans Day on Tuesday. Veterans Day is celebrated to commemorate the sacrifice and services rendered by our brave veterans.

The day is also a mark of respect for the services rendered by Field Marshal KM Cariappa, OBE, the first Commander-in-Chief of the Indian Army, who superannuated from service on January 14, 1953.

Lieutenant General Yogendra Dimri, AVSM, VSM, General Officer Commanding, Sudarshan Chakra Corps was the senior most serving officer to pay tribute at a solemn wreath laying ceremony at Dronachal War Memorial. Serving personnel and Veterans of the three services including disabled soldiers paid homage to their fallen comrades. The shared values and ethos of the three Services is a result of exemplary leadership and valuable guidance provided by the Veterans during their service. The Sudarshan Chakra Corps at Bhopal hosted a lunch for the Veterans where more than 300 ex-servicemen were felicitated.

Veterans Day is dedicated to the indomitable spirit of the personnel who served the Nation with pride, honour and total selflessness.

The event serves to strengthen the bond between serving personnel and their Veterans.

Title: State Govt to purchase Beech Craft King Air 250
Article:
The State Government has taken a decision to purchase a new aircraft by selling 18 years old Government aircraft B-200 of 2001. With the consent of the Cabinet, the State Government has signed an MoU with the aircraft manufacturing company M/s Textron Aviation Pvt. Ltd. of USA on November 15, 2019 to purchase new aircraft Turbine Engine 7+2 Seater- Model B-200 GT (Beech Craft King Air 250).

It is to be mentioned that a new jet aircraft is not being purchased by the state government but the new aircraft is being purchased by selling 18 years old aircraft. The old aircraft was no longer worth practical use because of the old technology. Moreover, the availability of spare parts required to repair this aircraft of old technology is also uncertain. Hence, a new aircraft is being purchased by selling this aircraft.

Title: Ashwani Sharma likely to be Punjab BJP chief
Article:
Ashwani Sharma, who took the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) to strong footing during the 2012 Punjab Assembly polls, is all set to take up the party reins in Punjab once again. It has been learnt that Sharma’s name has received a green signal from the party high command, and its formal announcement would be made on January 17.

Sources informed The Pioneer that the BJP organisational election in-charge for Punjab Shivraj Singh Chauhan, the former Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh, has reportedly submitted his report to the party high command, which has approved Sharma’s name for the coveted post.

However, the election for the State party president would be held as per schedule on January 17, when the formal announcement would be made.

Even as several party leaders were eyeing the post, continuous efforts were being made to elect the new president unanimously.

Besides Sharma, incumbent State chief Shwait Malik, former MP Avinash Rai Khanna, national general secretary Tarun Chugh, former Cabinet Minister Manoranjan Kalia, former Cabinet Minister Anil Joshi, party’s state vice-president Narinder Parmar, among others were in the race for the top post.

Since long, talks regarding replacing the incumbent Shwet Malik as the state unit president have been doing the rounds on the grounds that he was not making enough efforts to revive the party fortunes in the State. He was also criticised by a section of party leaders for not taking everyone along, besides winning the party’s senior leadership’s faith in party’s routine affairs.

Notably, Chauhan had met the party delegates from different constituencies of the State, besides the heads of various wings of the party in Ludhiana. On the basis of the same, he had prepared a report on the likely candidates. Along with that, all out efforts were being made to zero in on one name, as per earlier instances.

Sharma, the Punjab BJP’s former president, had earlier served the state unit between 2009 and 2012. A former MLA from Pathankot, Sharma reportedly enjoys the backing of RSS-appointed state organization secretary Dinesh Kumar besides other leaders.

It has been learnt that Sharma also managed to get support of some key leaders who were seen as members of the faction led by Kamal Sharma who passed away in November last year.

The party’s ideological mentor, Rashtriya Swayamsewak Sangh (RSS), has been reportedly throwing its weight behind Narinder Parmar, a little-known face in the State’s political circles.

The new party chief would be tasked not only with the challenge to revitalise the party in the state, but also to maintain cordial relations with the alliance partner Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD). It will be the new party chief under whose leadership the BJP would contest the next Assembly polls in 2022.

Considering the same, it seems that party has reposed its faith once again in Sharma, under whose leadership the party, in coalition with the Akali Dal, created a history by securing the second consecutive term in Punjab in 2012.

Title: Wool Fab evoking good response
Article:
Displaying various kinds of woolens this quivering winter, the Wool Fab is evoking a huge response by the Bhopalites.

A lot of varieties in woolens are being showcased at Wool Fab. It is organised by National Handloom Development Corporation.

With the onset of winter, stalls of J&K, Gujarat, Rajasthan and Uttaranchal showcased the woolen clothes and embroidery shawls, Jama shawls, ponchos and much more.

The colourful Pashmina shawls and stoles are majorly captivating the attention of the female participants. Over jackets received much positive response at the woolen fair.

This time people are especially captivated towards the embroidered jackets to add to their trendy style in winter season.

The vendors from Gujarat brought a beautiful range of embroidered jackets, fur jackets and over coats which are attracting the teenagers at the fair.

There is also a diverse range of sweaters and warm jackets for teenagers and children.

The wonderful varieties brought in leather material are an attraction for college students. Varieties of leather include Mink leather, Swiss leather and parachute. The fair is evoking a good response and people were opting to shop for trendy and new style woolens this winter is observed at the fair.

This is not only the limited stuff, the vendors brought for the citizens.

There was also stuff to decorate the interiors of the house this winter as well. Woolen rugs are especially brought, to adorn the beauty of your home this winter season.

Title: Min Chowdhary to launch ‘Aspire'
Article: Minister for School Education Prabhuram Chowdhary will launch portal ‘Aspire’ at Mantralya at 12 noon on January 16. Portal has been prepared with the help of the UNICEF for the students of class 9th to 12th of the Govt schools. The ‘Aspire’ is in fact a future opportunity portal. Information pertaining to college fee, subjects, admission procedure etc. of all the colleges of national and State level can be obtained from this portal. Students by self login on this portal can gather information as regard to subjects of their own interest.

Title: ‘Bhaag Avanti Bhaag’ performed
Article:
A comedy play ‘Bhaag Avanti Bhaag’ was staged at Ravindra Bhavan here on Tuesday. In a society where parents take daughter’s wedding as a status building, these parents have permitted their daughter to runaway.

Directed by Rajeev Verma, the play was performed by the artists of Bhopal Theatre Group. The play is adapted from a Marathi comedy play whose Hindi translation and conceptualisation is done by Praveen Muhavale.

The play revolves around a middle class family and the trials middle class families go through. Through different scenes and situations, the play was beautifully staged at Ravindra Bhavan. The play was much enjoyed by the Bhopalites.

Adding a pinch of comedy, the play wonderfully showcased about the situations of a middle class family. If a member of a middle class family suffers with a disease, then the deposited amount which is earned working hard all through the life is taken in the treatment.The trouble increases even when the daughter is ready for a marriage and there is no money to get her married.

Then what happens next formed rest of the story making the situations worse as well as comic. In this situation the parents think that if the girl runs away with someone, then they will be saved from the marriage expenses.

The extremely energetic performances by the artists made the play watching worthwhile. Besides, the use of stage backdrop and the mature direction by Rajeev Verma was also commendable.

Title: Valuables worth Rs 85,000 burgled
Article:
Valuables worth Rs 85,000 were burgled from Kalyan Nagar under Chhola Mandir Police station on Modnay.

Police said that the victim Rohit Panthi family had gone to Ganjbasoda on January 12 and when he returned on Monday valuables were found burgled.

A complaint was lodged by the victim with the Chola Mandir police and in his complaint, he stated family had gone to Ganjbasoda during which miscreants escaped with valuables.

After they received the information, they returned house and found that jewelry and Rs 38,000 cash were burgled. The total loss in the burglary was claimed to be around Rs 85,000.

Based on the complaint after the preliminary investigation the police have registered a case under sections 457 and 380 of the IPC and have started further investigation.

Meanwhile, bag carrying worth Rs 90,000 was stolen from a parked bike at Sant Asharam Nagar under Baghsewania police station area; a case was registered a Monday.

Police said that the victim DD Sahu returned house and his bag carrying Rs 85,000 cash and documents was stolen from his parked bike.

A complaint was lodged with the Baghsewania police stating that he returned home on November 24, 2019 and parked his bike outside his house in the afternoon after sometime when he went to check the bag was found stolen.

Initially the victim tried to search for the bag and later he filed complaint on Monday.

The police have registered a case under sections 379 of the IPC and have started further investigation.

Title: 42-year-man robbed near ITI Govindpura
Article:
A 42-year-man was robbed, Rs 4,500 and an ATM card by three scooter borne miscreants near ITI Govindpura in the night on Monday.

Police said that the victim Gurudayal Dhakad was robbed by three scooter borne miscreants near ITI Govindpura at around 10.30 in the night.

The victim approached Govindpura police and lodged a complaint stating that he was on his way to home after weekly market where he sells electronic goods and when he reached near ITI Govindpura three scooter borne miscreants stopped his bike and alleged that he had hit their scooter and one of them grabbed his hands while other two took cash and ATM card and escaped the spot.

In his complaint victim stated that he was not able to notice registration number of the scooter and colour of the scooter due to low light. The police have registered a case under section 392 of the IPC and started further investigation.

Meanwhile, Baghsewania police have booked two unidentified miscreants who attempted to break an ATM at Narayan Nagar late on Monday night.According to the police, ATM was damaged by scooter borne miscreants who failed to get through the machine and reach the cash which was their target. The miscreants broke CCTV and light on entering the ATM.

Police said that the CCTV footages would be searched and would help in the identification and nabbing the miscreants. The house owner where the ATM is installed woke up and raise alert which forced the miscreants to escape the spot.

Title: Nine medals on 4th day
Article:
In Khelo India Youth Games, Madhya Pradesh players performed brilliantly on the fourth day, bagging Madhya Pradesh nine medals, including two gold, four silver and three bronze.

It is noteworthy that Madhya Pradesh players have so far won 9 gold, Has earned a total of 26 medals including 8 silver and 9 bronze.

On Tuesday, under the competition, in the 1500 meter race competition of Athletics in the Athletics, the talented runner of Athletics Academy, Sunil Dabur, scored 3.54.75 m/s. Taking the time of the year, made a new meet record and gave the gold medal to Madhya Pradesh. In the boys under-17 academy, Arjun Vaskale, player of the academy, scored 3.56.49 m/s and Abhishek Thakur scored 3.57.94 m /s and won silver and bronze medals respectively.

It is noteworthy that in the competition, Sunil Dabur has won 1 gold, 1 silver, Arjun Vaskale 1 gold, 1 silver and Abhishek Thakur 2 bronze medals. Athletics players from Madhya Pradesh have earned a total of 14 medals including 6 gold, 4 silver and 4 bronze. Out of which 11 medals including 4 gold, 4 silver and 3 bronze have been earned by the academy players.

Director Sports and Youth Welfare SL Thoussen commended the excellent performance by the players of Madhya Pradesh Athletics Academy at the Khelo India Youth Games.

Thoussen said that it has been only three years since the Athletics Academy was established and State players have showcased their talent at the national level and have made Madhya Pradesh proud by winning medals. Thoussen congratulated academy's players and coaches.

In the final of table tennis under the Khelo India Youth Games, Anusha Kutumbale defeated Maharashtra's player 4-0 (11-4, 11-9, 11-5, 11-3) to give Madhya Pradesh a gold medal. Academy player Rituraj Bundela earned silver and Arjun Thakur earned bronze in the competition against the Shotgun Skeet Shooting Under-21 boys category played.

In the Under-17 Air Rifle, Indore (MP) player Anshika Gupta gave the silver medal to Madhya Pradesh. Similarly, in the under-21 boys category of judo competition,

Shubham Rajput won silver in the -90 kg category and Amisha earned bronze in the -78 kg category.

Title: Whitetopping optimal solution for durable road
Article:
Daily commuting for the citizens of Bhopal continue to deteriorate due to the increase in potholes and the lack of road maintenance. Worsening road infrastructure intensifies the negative impact on the residents’ lifestyle with the rise invehicular traffic and road accidents.

This predicament prevails not only in Bhopal but all across India, with a number of accidents and deaths reported due to potholes on a regular basis.

Crucial stretches such as Minal to towards Raisen (JK Road) or Suraj Nagar Chouraha to Nilbad-Ratibad in Bhopal, are a few examples that repeatedly faces unpleasant commuter experience due to reoccurring of potholes and unsafe roads.

Hence, it becomes vital to implement a technology that is durable and sustainable in nature and facilitates an enhanced commuter experience, whitetopping, in this respect, is the optimal solution to ensure safer and durable roads with minimum repairs over its entire lifecycle of 20 years.

Stretches such as VIP Road or the side roads of BRTC Corridor (DB Mall to Misrod) are case studies that have been refurbished with whitetopping technology which has facilitated a smoother and safe commuter experience for the citizens.

The technology has gained widespread popularity and public acceptance due to its holistic benefits, such as being environmentally friendly and highly economical during its lifecycle, which provides pothole free roads for over 20 years.

Whitetopping requires much less maintenance and as such involves much less frequent lane closures of road, as compared to bituminous surfaces.

This solution has been implemented across major cities in India, which has proved to be a significant game changer for ensuring pothole-free roads.

Across India, over 1000km of Whitetopping projects have been successfully completed, including construction in major cities such as Mumbai, Thane, Nagpur, Pune, Bengaluru, Kanpur among others.

Bhishma Kumar Chugh, National Level Project Monitor, Govt. of. India - Ministry of Road Transport & Highway; Former Director General, CPWD, Union Ministry of Urban Development, “Whitetopping is widely known to be highly sustainable and economical in nature. With a lifecycle of over 20 years, whitetopping facilitates pothole free roads with minimum repair required.

This has been one of the main reasons behind the high degree of acceptance by the citizens for the technology, given the holistic benefits on offer. With vehicular population increasing on a gradual

basis, whitetopping provides a complete solution to India’s poor urban road infrastructure.”

Er MK Gupta, Retd E-in-C, MP Rural Road Development Authority Bhopal, shared, “As per the new technology whitetopping provides pothole free roads and good riding surfaces, it also has a lesser burden on natural resources with reduced utilization of aggregates and minimum repair required over its 20 year long life cycle.

Highly sustainable and durable in nature, whitetoppedroad’s quality remains consistent and provides a definitive solution for a good quality roads for long period. It is idealfor rapidly urbanizing India.”

Title: Cabinet seeks disciplinary action against Bajwa
Article:
A day after Congress’ Rajya Sabha MP Partap Singh Bajwa raised a banner of revolt against Punjab Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh, all the state Cabinet Ministers on Tuesday demanded “in one voice” disciplinary action by the party leadership against him.

As per the government’s official statement, the issue came up for informal discussion just before the Cabinet meeting on Tuesday evening.

It stated that there was consensus among the Ministers on the need for “action against Bajwa”.

The demand for action against Bajwa came in the wake of his latest remarks, declaring that he would not support Capt Amarinder’s leadership for a second term unless action is taken in the sacrilege cases.

“The Chief Minister had made it clear from the outset that he is committed to bringing the culprits of the sacrilege incidents to book, but would not indulge in vindictive politics.

Bajwa’s stand smacked of vendetta and has no place in a principled party like the Congress,” said the Ministers.

The Ministers pointed out that despite repeated pleas asking him to express his opinions within the party forum, Bajwa continued to criticize Capt Amarinder and his Government in media and other places.

“The MP has gone so far as to seek a change at the helm of the government,” they noted with dismay, terming it an act of sheer indiscipline and urging the party leadership to take immediate action against the former Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) chief.

The Ministers accused Bajwa of playing into the hands of the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) by pitching himself against his own party leadership, especially at a time when the entire opposition was in a state of disarray, posing no real challenge to the Congress in the State.

“Such rebellion, if not nipped in the bud, could send the wrong message down the rank and file of the Punjab Congress, which has been on a high since taking over the State’s reins around three years,” said the Ministers.

The Ministers added, while the Congress was run on democratic principles, where every member had a say, such public display of difference of opinion and mutinous declarations from a senior member were detrimental to the interest of the party, and under no circumstances, could this kind of behaviour be tolerated or allowed to continue.

Sports Minister Rana Gurmeet Singh Sodhi stressed that it was absolutely imperative to act against Bajwa as such behaviour would weaken the party.

“We cannot allow this to become a free for all,” said Technical Education Minister Charanjit Singh Channi.

The Local Government Minister Brahm Mohindra wanted the Chief Minister to take up the issue with the Congress high command in Delhi, adding that any dissent should be discussed and resolved within the party forum.

Finance Minister Manpreet Badal pointed out that history showed dissension of any sort had always harmed the Congress. “We succeeded in winning so many seats in Punjab only because we were united,” he said, adding that this unity could not be allowed to be destroyed at any cost.

Medical Education Minister Om Prakash Soni, Forest Minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot, and Rural Development and Panchayats Minister Tript Rajinder Singh Bajwa were also quick to point out that Partap Bajwa’s actions were extremely damaging for the party, and urgent and immediate action was needed against him.

Other Ministers — Aruna Chaudhary, Razia Sultana, Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa, Sukhjinder Singh Sarkaria, Gurpreet Singh Kangar, Vijay Inder Singla, Sunder Sham Arora and Bharat Bhushan Ashu — were also in total agreement with their colleagues in seeking urgent intervention by the party high command in the matter.

Terming as “shocking” Bajwa’s remarks that Punjab Congress could only survive without Capt Amarinder, the Ministers pointed out that the Congress, under the present government, had swept all elections in the State since the 2017 Assembly polls, which clearly showed the people were happy and satisfied with his style of functioning, and the party was doing immensely well with him as Chief Minister.

Further, they pointed out, that under Capt Amarinder’s dynamic leadership, Punjab had witnessed major resurgence on all counts and was progressing at a significant pace, despite the poor economic legacy inherited by the government.

“But Bajwa is clearly not interested in development and only wanted to make a political point to promote his self-interest, with his frequent diatribes against the Chief Minister,” they added

Pointing out that Capt Amarinder had himself, on several occasions, stressed the need to hand over the baton to the younger generation, the leaders, however, said that the time was not ripe for such a move in Punjab, which had suffered major problems under the SAD-BJP regime.

Punjab needed the visionary leadership of Capt Amarinder and clearly did not want someone like Bajwa, who seemed to spend all his time indulging in negative and destructive politics, at the helm.

Describing as unfortunate Bajwa’s comments on employment, the Ministers lambasted him for focusing on petty politics instead of strengthening the Chief Minister’s hands in his efforts to ensure jobs for all and progress for every citizen of Punjab.

“At a time when every member of the party should be involved in reviving the state’s economy and powering its growth, Bajwa seemed bent on pulling the party and the government down,” said the Ministers, demanding immediate action against the MP.

Title: CABINET GIVES GO-AHEAD FOR RESOLUTION TO RATIFY CONSTITUTIONAL 126TH AMENDMENT
Article:
Punjab Cabinet on Tuesday authorized Punjab Governor VP Singh Badnore to summon a two-day Special Session of Vidhan Sabha.

The Cabinet has also given a go-ahead for placing resolution to ratify the Constitutional 126th Amendment and enactment of Goods and Services Tax Act.

The Cabinet has decided to recommend to the Governor to summon the 10th Session of the 15th Punjab Vidhan Sabha, as per the Article 174(1) of the Constitution of India, for two days on January 16 and 17, 2020, said an official spokesperson, adding that it was decided by the Cabinet to change the timing of the commencement of the session.

The session will accordingly start on January 16 with the speech of Governor at 11 am, instead of 10 am, as scheduled earlier.

On January 17, the session would begin at 10 am with obituary references, followed by presentation of a resolution to ratify The Constitution (126th Amendment) Bill, 2019.

The House would adjourn sine-die after the proposed legislative business on the same day, said the spokesperson.

The Constitution (126th Amendment) Bill, 2019 seeks to extend the reservation for Scheduled Castes in Punjab for another 10 years, with effect from January 25, 2020.

It may be recalled that the Amendment Bill 126 had been passed by the Lok Sabha on December 10, 2019 and by the Rajya Sabha on December 12, 2019.

Meanwhile, the Cabinet has also approved enactment of the Punjab Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019, with the relevant Bill to be presented under clause 2 of Article 213 of Constitution.

The Punjab Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019 was issued vide notification on December 31, 2019, promulgated in order to bring certain visionary amendments in the 2017 Act for facilitation of taxpayers and promotion of ‘Ease of doing Business’.

Title: Heritage items as ‘art treasures' in Chandigarh
Article:
The heritage items in Chandigarh will get the status of “art treasures”, if the Chandigarh Administration’s proposal to give legal protection to such items turns into a reality.

In a bid to preserve heritage items in the city, the Chandigarh Administration is mulling over notifying them as “art treasures”.

The Administration has so far miserably failed to stop the theft of heritage items from Chandigarh and its auction being held by foreign based auction houses.

According to the inventory prepared by the UT Administration in the year 2012, Chandigarh has ‘12793’ heritage items designed by city’s creator French Architect Le Corbusier or his team associated with the founding and planning of the city in 1950s and 60s.

There are 190 different categories of the heritage items including drawings, murals, models, tapestries, chairs, tables, among others.

The Administration has also proposed to carry out “physical verification” of identified heritage items by experts to ascertain its “genuineness”.

As per the action plan chalked out for the restoration and preservation of heritage items, the Chandigarh Administration will approach Union Ministry of Culture and Archaeological Survey of India (ASI), after consulting its Legal Department for giving legal protection to the heritage items.

“For the preservation of heritage items, we are exploring the option of declaring it as art treasures. It is proposed to approach ASI to notify Chandigarh’s heritage items as art treasures,” said a senior officer of UT Administration while talking to The Pioneer.

The proposal was discussed by Chandigarh Heritage Protection Cell. It was also recommended to collect data on previous instances of items being declared “art treasures” under the Antiquities and Art Treasures Act, 1972, the senior officer said.

Pursuant to the Antiquities and Art Treasures Act, 1972, the Union Ministry of Education and Social Welfare had promulgated the Antiquities and Art Treasure Rules, 1973. The rules state that the Central Government before declaring any human work of art as an “art treasure” may constitute a committee of at least three members to submit a report on the artistic and aesthetic value of such human work of art.

“Art treasure” means “any human work of art, not being an antiquity, declared by the Central Government by notification in the official gazette, to be an art treasure for the purposes of this Act having regard to its artistic or aesthetic value, provided that no declaration under this clause shall be made in respect of any such work of art so long as the author thereof is alive.”

The UT officer said that by giving a legal status to the heritage items, the Chandigarh Administration will be able to protect these items and take legal action in matters of theft or damage to heritage items.

Notably, the UT Administration had in 2014 also approached ASI seeking assistance in establishing the “genuineness” of heritage items, identified during the finalization of heritage inventory made in 2011 and 2012 here. However, the ASI had turned down the Administration’s request.

Quoting “The Antiquities And Art Treasures Act, 1972”, the ASI had in 2014 stated ‘antiquities’ which have been in existence for not less than 100 years viz. sculptures in stone, terracotta, metals, ivory Painting in paper, wood, cloth, skin etc and manuscripts are covered under the Act while the heritage items in the city are less than 60 years old.

Hence, the ASI will not be able to assist the Administration in conservation works of heritage belonging to Chandigarh, stated the ASI in its letter.

Among various departments in Chandigarh, the UT Government Museum and Art Gallery has a possession of large number of heritage items including furniture, drawings, murals, models among others made by renowned architect Le Corbusier and his other associates. Besides, Punjab and Haryana Civil Secretariat, Punjab and Haryana Vidhan Sabha, Punjab and Haryana High Court also have huge stock of heritage furniture including chairs, sofas and tables.

Title: After expensive housing scheme, CHB reduces price of flats
Article:
Considering the lukewarm response to its costliest housing scheme in Sector 53 here, the Chandigarh Housing Board (CHB) on Tuesday decided to further slash the cost of the flats.

The Board members of CHB, who met on Tuesday to decide the fate of the housing scheme decided to reduce the cost of the flats in the proposed housing scheme at Sector 53. Besides, the last date for submission of online application for the scheme has been extended upto February 23, 2020.

Around 148 people had applied under the housing scheme offering 492 flats in Sector 53. Under the housing scheme, the CHB intends to construct 192 HIG flats, 100 MIG flats, 120 LIG flats and 80 EWS units.

During the Board meeting, it has been decided that the CHB will not charge any profit in either category of the dwelling unit, said a senior officer of CHB.

The revised price of the flats under the proposed housing scheme is Rs 1.50 crore for a flat with three-bedroom, hall and kitchen (HIG-BHK), Rs 1.28 cr for 2 BHK (MIG), Rs 86 lakh for one BHK (LIG). The price of the economically weaker section (EWS) flats has remained unchanged at Rs 50 lakh.

This is for the second time that the CHB has revised the price of flats after launching the scheme in July 2019.

Earlier, the price was reduced in November after a demand survey was conducted to check whether there was a demand for the general housing in the city or not.

In July last year, the CHB had proposed a HIG-BHK flat for Rs 1.80 crore, MIG flat for Rs 1.47 crore, 1 BHK (LIG) for Rs 95 lakh and EWS units for Rs 50 lakh, receiving a lot of criticism from various sections.

The CHB’s senior officer said that it has also been decided that the allottees will be allowed to pay cost of the flats in five equated installments (each of six months) spanning over 30 months subject to payment of interest at the rate Rs 12 percent per annum.

After launch of the scheme, for speedily construction of the dwelling units, the construction work will be awarded to two or three agencies, he said.

The last date for submission of online application has been extended upto February 23.

However the window for online submission of application will be opened from next week and a public notice with required details will be issued separately, he added.

The deadline for applying under the scheme had ended on December 31.

Title: 17-yr-old Pakistani boy sent back home after almost 2 years
Article:
A 17-year-old Pakistani boy was sent back home on Tuesday to the neighbouring nation, two years after he inadvertently crossed over to the Indian territory in 2018 following a tiff with his family.

After he was released from a juvenile home in Punjab''s Hoshiarpur district on Tuesday morning, Mubashar Bilal, a resident of border village Wazirpur of Pakistan''s Kasur district, was taken to the Attari-Wagah border in Amritsar where he was handed over to Pakistani authorities, officials said.

Bilal, who is also known as Mubarak, was handed over to the Pakistani Rangers by the Border Security Force (BSF) personnel around 1:30 pm, they said.

Bilal said he had left home in a huff following a fight with his family members.

"There was a bit of a fight at home and I left it in anger. I could not come to know (entering India) and then I was caught by the BSF personnel," Bilal said, adding that he spent almost 20-22 months here.

Bilal crossed over to Pakistan on the basis of the ''Emergency Travel Certificate'' issued by the Pakistan High Commission.

Talking to reporters at Attari, Bilal said he was "very happy" to return to his family in Pakistan.

"I am very happy today (to return home)," said an elated Bilal.

He also praised Indian authorities for treating him well and said he was indebted for that.

"I have a mother, brother and sister there (in Pakistan)," he replied to a question.

Asked whether he will come to India again if he gets a visa, he replied, "surely."

Earlier during the day, Hoshiarpur Deputy Commissioner Isha Kalia said Bilal was released from a juvenile home at 7 am on Tuesday.

An order pertaining to his release from the Centre was received five to six days back, Kalia told PTI.

He had been kept in a juvenile home in Hoshiarpur after he was held by the BSF in February 2018.

Bilal had inadvertently entered Indian territory. He was held from Khemkaran village of Punjab''s Tarn Taran district and was later booked under relevant sections of the Foreigners Act and the Passport Act.

He was acquitted of all charges by the Juvenile Justice Board in September 2018.

Hailing from a poor family, his father Mohammad Akbar was reportedly a daily wager in Pakistan and was longing to have a glimpse of his son ever since he left home.

Bilal''s father reportedly had even raised the demand for repatriation of his son in the Pakistani media. Later, various social activists in India had launched a campaign for the release of Bilal and his repatriation to Pakistan.

Title: Kandhamal MP’s unique initiative to provide employment
Article:
It was the time of general elections in 2019. People were putting their demands on the table. The political parties were working on their manifestos and politicians were on the streets meeting and listening to people.

An internationally-acclaimed social worker and educationist, Dr Achyuta Samanta, who had recently entered politics, was declared Lok Sabha candidate from the Biju Janata Dal (BJD) by its supremo Naveen Patnaik

Dr Samanta earned his position among the respected and decorated social activists and educationists of the world by uplifting more than 50,000 indigenous children who studied or were studying free of cost at the Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences (KISS), Bhubaneswar, the world’s largest indigenous residential institute established by him. Knowing that they had got an exemplary candidate, people’s expectations were high in the Kandhamal constituency. Some of the most critical issues in the constituency identified by the Niti Ayog’s most backward and Aspirational Districts were “poverty, underdevelopment and unemployment”.

Dr Samanta could come up with an idea with relative ease on the strength of his three-decade-long track record in the field of poverty eradication. He understood that unless per-family purchasing capacity or disposable income is improved, the constituency and its people won’t come out of their predicament ever. He got elected with a thumping majority and started his work right away.

Amongst other initiatives, he took upon himself a target to provide meaningful employment to at least 10,000 youths of the constituency every year. It was an uphill task given the declining GDP and record unemployment rate in the country. However, he made a start, forming a team of 100 people from his own organisation who conducted a detailed survey to obtain details of every unemployed youth. The task, although a tedious one due to the hilly terrain, was completed within a couple of months. The data gathered had individual details including the qualification and preferred career option.

He then engaged his team to contact all the quality organisations in his knowledge and identify their manpower requirements that these youths could meet. Out of the hundreds of organisations contacted, around 80 were found to be a match. But most of the youths were under-matric; so, some basic skill training had to be provided before they could become employable. To bridge this gap, he set up two new Skill Training Centres with his own resources. His team went out on the field again. They gathered the youths from every block, counselled them, and brought them to the skill centres for basic training.

Two mega job fairs at Phulbani and Boudh were held to bring the shortlisted organisations and youths together. The district administrations of both the districts also joined hands.
