Bringing officials from 80 organisations and around 10,000 youths from both the places was a logistic nightmare. But the “never give up” attitude of Dr Samanta kept the team going. Tens of flights landed in Bhubaneswar bringing in the company representatives; hundreds of hotel rooms were booked to accommodate them and comfortable buses were lined up to take them to Phulnani and Boudh, each hundreds of kilometers away. Hundreds of buses also reached each of the 20 blocks of the constituency to bring the youths to the job fairs. And as many as 7,000 youths were employed in only two days, indeed a record.

Dr Samanta gave a briefing to the waiting mediapersons, walked back quietly in his car and drove off.

Title: Commercial consumers to be targeted in 1st phase
Article:
The mass disconnection of electricity supply by Central Electricity Supply Utility (Cesu) would begin from January 16 with defaulting commercial consumers facing termination in the first phase.

In the second phase, the financially strong domestic consumers, who despite having the capability to repay the bills have withheld the payment deliberately, would be targeted, said Cesu Senior General Manager Manoj Singh on Tuesday.

Singh reiterated the Cesu’s resolve to start the disconnection drive from January 16, 2020 and said, “413 squads have been formed to carry out this exercise in nine districts under the jurisdiction of Cesu. The squads will move in their assigned route and disconnect the power supply of defaulting consumers.”

“Reports that thousands of villages will go dark are untrue as only the identified defaulting consumers will lose power supply,” he added.

Notably, Cesu Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Arun Bothra had announced the decision on December 10, 2019 and provided the deadline of January 15, 2020 for the defaulting consumers to clear their dues.

However, the Opposition BJP and Congress attacked the Government terming the Cesu’s drive unconstitutional.

BJP State general secretary Lekhasri Samantsinhar said “The data given by the State Government in the Assembly revealed that power distribution companies (discoms) operating in the State owed a whopping Rs 7,657 crore to Grid Corporation of Odisha Limited (Gridco). However, it is unfortunate that the Cesu is going to force 11, 397 villages into darkness for defaulting payments.”

Congress MLA Suresh Routray said, “We have requested Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik and the Energy Minister not to interrupt examination preparations of students by disconnecting power supply. If the Government interferes in their study, we will not tolerate it and give a befitting reply by launching a massive protest,” Routray said.

“If the Government is concerned about the pending bills, it should collect the dues from the industrialists first,” he added.

Samajwadi Party State president Rabi Behera demanded the Chief Minister’s intervention to roll back the decision. Behera, in a letter to the CM, said people should be given time till March 31 to pay their pending dues.

Title: 5T action: Malkangiri DSWO, CDPO axed
Article:
Acting under the 5-T move, the State Government on Tuesday suspended the District Social Welfare Officer (DSWO) and Child Development Project Officer (CDPO) of Malkangiri for their alleged involvement in corruption.

DSWO Swarnalata Biswas and CDPO Biplua Sardar were placed under suspension on the inquiry report of the district collector.

Sardar used to collect percentage while working as Supervisor in Korakonda and Padia blocks and had allegedly misappropriated Government funds. She had also been suspended earlier. Knowing that she was tainted Supervisor, DSWO Biswal had recommended Bipula’s name to the district Collector for promotion.

Biswas had even ignored the Collector’s directive that sought an inquiry into corruption allegations against Bipula before giving her a promotion.

The Collector had sent a report about the two officials to the State Government following which disciplinary action was taken against the two officers.

Title: Won’t be browbeaten by Capt’s tactics, hold public debate with me: Bajwa
Article:
Punjab Congress’ two top leaders — Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh and Rajya Sabha MP Partap Singh Bajwa — have once again come face-to-face against one another.

As the state Cabinet Ministers opened front on behalf of Capt Amarinder against Bajwa, the Punjab Congress’ former president declared that he would not be browbeaten by Capt Amarinder’s tactics.

“My accountability is to the people of Punjab and I shall not be browbeaten by these tactics of Capt Amarinder Singh. He could not muster enough courage to rebut my allegations but needed the shelter of his reluctant Cabinet colleagues to do the same,” Bajwa said.

Bajwa, whom Capt Amarinder had replaced as the Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) president just ahead the 2017 state assembly elections, dared the Chief Minister to “hold a public debate with him on the issues he raised and let the public be the judge”.

Title: JJP to field its candidates on 12-18 seats in Delhi elections: Dushyant
Article:
Senior Jannayak Janata Party (JJP) leader and Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala on Tuesday said that his party will put candidates on 12 to 18 seats in the Delhi Assembly election.

He said JJP may contest election in an alliance with BJP and leaders of both the parties will meet in New Delhi in a couple of days to finalise the alliance and seat sharing between the parties. "However, the final decision will be taken by the five-member committee of JJP which has been formed recently", he said.

Referring to previous Delhi elections, Dushyant said that the supporters of JJP are in more than one and half dozen constituencies in Delhi.

Asked about JJP MLA from Narnaund Ram Kumar Gautam who had earlier resigned as the party’s national vice-president and refused to meet him to resolve the differences, Dushyant said that party is united and all the issues have been sorted out.

Title: International Saraswati Mahotsav from Jan 27
Article:
Haryana Government will celebrate International Saraswati Mahotsav from January 27 to 29 in Adi Badri, Yamunanagar district, Additional Chief Secretary, Arts and Cultural Affairs Department, Dheera Khandelwal said on Tuesday.

The three-day 'International Saraswati Mahotsav' will be attended by people from all over India as well as the State. Apart from this, the State Government has also sent an invitation to the Ambassadors of other countries, she said.

Presiding over a review meeting held for the preparation of the International Saraswati Mahotsav here, Khandelwal directed the officers concerned that special attention should be paid for ensuring safety and cleanliness in the Mahotsav. She directed that the use of plastic should be minimum to make the Mahotsav environment-friendly and eco-friendly material should be used for the publicity of this Mahotsav.The officers shared that on January 27 to 29, Sarasvati Mela will be organized in Pehowa and cultural program will be organized in the day and evening. Apart from this, Saraswati Maha Aarti will also be performed on all three days.

It was informed and that an exhibition will also be held at Pehowa in which the academics, Sarasvati Nadi Shodh Sansthan, Archaeology and Museum Department, Agriculture and Farmer Welfare Department, Haryana Dairy Development Co. Federation, Center of Excellence, Kurukshetra will hold exhibition.

Title: Police suspends 4 personnel after escape of army deserter
Article:
Punjab Police on Tuesday placed under suspension its four personnel for negligence after an Army deserter, Harpreet Singh, escaped from Hoshiarpur civil hospital in the wee hours. Harpreet, who was undergoing some treatment in the civil hospital, had been in police custody for stealing two INSAS rifles from the Army Training Centre at Panchmarhi in Hoshangabad district of Madhya Pradesh on December 5.

Harpreet reportedly pushed aside the police guard while returning from the toilet and fled.

He was arrested from Tanda on December 9 along with accomplice Jagtar Singh alias Jagga, who is the son of Khalistan Zindabad Force militant Harbhajan Singh.

Harpreet was shifted to the civil hospital’s prisoners’ ward on December 31 with a fractured forearm. Sources informed that around 4 am on Tuesday, his handcuffs were removed as he asked to use the toilet but when he was returning to the ward, he pushed back the guard and ran away.

Soon after the incident, senior police officials rushed to the hospital, while the search teams were dispatched to the bus stand and railway station. However, the escapee could not be found.

Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Gaurav Garg said that the police of the entire region were on alert.

At the same time, he indicated that strict action would be taken against the four suspended policemen.

“This is a very serious case. They deserve a much severe action than just suspension,” he said.

Posing as army personnel, Harpreet and Jagga, had stolen two INSAS assault rifles, three magazines and 20 cartridges from the sentries at the training centre.

Title: Day after heavy rain, mercury drops again in Punjab, Haryana
Article:
A day after heavy rainfall in the region, mercury settled several notches below normal in parts of Punjab and Haryana on Tuesday.

While bright sunshine was witnessed in some parts of the region, foggy conditions and overcast sky left the residents shivering in many parts throughout the day.Narnaul in Haryana shivered at minimum temperature of 3.5 degree Celsius, one degree below normal while Hisar also recorded a minimum of 3.5 degree Celsius, three notches below normal.A Met official said that both minimum and maximum temperature levels settled below normal in various parts of the region.

Chandigarh, the joint capital of Punjab and Haryana recorded minimum temperature at 8.6 degree Celsius. The city saw maximum of 13.3 degree Celsius, down by seven notches from normal.Among other places in Haryana, Bhiwani recorded minimum temperature at 5.3 degrees, Ambala settled at a low of 7.6 degrees Celsius and Karnal recoded 8 degree Celsius.

Punjab’s Amritsar recorded a low of 3.7 degree Celsius. Industrial city-Ludhiana- saw minimum temperature at 5.8 degree Celsius.

Title: MLAs to have say in Budget: Khattar
Article:
Haryana Chief Minister, Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday said that for the first time in the budget session of Haryana assembly, all MLAs would be given the opportunity to speak and discuss on different topics during the first three days and only after that the budget would be presented so that schemes related to public interest could be included in the budget.

Interacting with representatives of industrial organizations associated with the manufacturing sector in Panipat. Khattar said that this is the first time that a meeting of pre-budget consultation has been held with various stake holders related to the economy before the budget in which discussion has been made with the people associated with manufacturing sector in Panipat.

He said that earlier this meeting was held in Gurugram with people associated with service sector and real estate. A similar meeting has been convened in Faridabad on January 15 and thereafter in Hisar on January 16 related to agriculture and allied services.

"A good budget would be prepared by incorporating the suggestions of various industrial organizations and MLAs, which is also the need of the hour. In the same series, a similar meeting would also be held in Panchkula", he added.

Khattar said the government has done a commendable job to make Haryana an energy efficient state and the line loses have been brought down from 34 percent to 21 percent and it would be further reduced to 15 percent.

He said that those industrial organizations would be encouraged, which would give maximum employment to the youth of the state. Apart from this, such industries would also be encouraged, which would make minimum use of land and would reuse water. On this occasion, he also interacted with the representatives of various organizations present in the meeting and took their suggestions in writing.

President, Haryana Chamber of Commerce and Industries Vinod Kumar Khandelwal suggested to implement the Textile policy and reduce the rate of interest of banks. Responding to this, the Chief Minister said that that the Textile Policy would be implemented after the Budget Session. President of Panipat Exporters Association Lalit Goyal and President of Handloom Exporters Manufacturing Association Ramesh Verma said that that there are 18,000 small units of handlooms in Panipat and for this; a separate sector should be developed. He also suggested for the setting up of a lab testing center and exhibition center.

Throwing light on the pre-budget consultations through a presentation, Additional Chief Secretary, Finance TVSN Prasad said that Haryana has an unprecedented contribution in economy of the country and after promoting the manufacturing sector, this contribution would be further increased.

Title: Teaching, non-teaching staff posts in schools to be filled
Article:
Punjab Government has decided to fill up as many as 3186 posts of various cadres in teaching and non-teaching staff in schools.

The Cabinet, approved the School Education Department proposal to fill up the posts to plug a major gap in the school staff, thereby improving the standards of education, said an official spokesperson after the meeting.

During the meeting, the Chief Minister underlined the need for serious relook at the school curriculum from the point of making students job-ready.

Pointing out that vocational courses had been introduced for senior classes in various fields, such as hospitality and mobile phone repair etc, he stressed on the importance of more thrust on vocational teaching.In line with the proposal of School Education Department, the Cabinet gave nod to fill up 132 posts of Deputy District Education Officer, Principal of Government Senior Secondary Schools, 311 Headmasters or Headmistresses, 2182 masters or mistresses in various subjects, 32 Block Primary Education Officers (BPEOs), 500 Elementary Trained Teachers, four law officers and 25 legal assistants.

The annual financial implication of the move, for the first three years during the probation period, would be Rs 42 crore per annum approximately.

“Once the probation period is over and the employees are given the full scale, the annual financial implication will be Rs 197 crore per annum approximately,” said the spokesperson.Notably, all these posts, except Principals, Headmasters and BPEOs, would be filled up through the Directorate of Recruitment, already set up in the Department since October 12, 2015.

The posts of Principals, Headmasters and BPEOs shall be filled up through the Punjab Public Service Commission.

To utilize the services of clerks optimally, the Department has proposed to follow the methodology for rationalization of clerks to dispose of the official work expeditiously as well as efficaciously.

PUNJAB RIGHT TO BUSINESS ACT TO BE TABLED DURING TWO-DAY SESSION

To facilitate business for Micro Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs), the Punjab Cabinet on Tuesday gave the go-ahead for bringing the Punjab Right to Business Act, 2020, in the forthcoming two-day special session of the Vidhan Sabha.

The spokesperson said that the Act is aimed at easing the regulatory burden on newly incorporated MSMEs by providing enabling provision of self-declaration, besides exemption from certain approvals and inspections for establishment and operations of MSMEs in Punjab.

With this Act, the MSMEs in the State will get a big relief from the tedious process of getting regulatory approvals before setting up of the units.

The Act would encompass various regulatory services, including sanction of building plans, issuance of completion or occupation certificate for buildings, registration of new trade license under the Punjab Municipal Act, 1911, and the Punjab Municipal Corporation Act 1976, sanction of building plans, among others.

Spokesperson said that the Act provides for a District Bureau of Enterprise (DBE) in each district headed by the Deputy Commissioner as chief executive officer, while General Manager of the District Industries Centre (DIC) would act as the Additional Chief Executive Officer, with other members to be notified by the Government from

time-to-time.

The DBE shall be designated as District Level Nodal Agency, which would work under the overall superintendence, direction and control of the State Government and the State Nodal Agency.

Title: Man fined Rs 26K for letting minor son ride bike
Article:
A person of the Barang area in Cuttack district was slapped a fine of Rs 26,000 by the Cuttack RTO officials on Tuesday for allowing his minor son to ride a two-wheeler.

Sources said that Sagar, son of one Mangaraj Parida, was riding the scooter without wearing helmet. Near Barang Chhak, traffic police and RTO officials intercepted him and imposed the fine of Rs 26,000 on the minor’s father.

While a penalty of Rs 1,000 was imposed for driving without helmet, another fine of Rs 25,000 was slapped for allowing the minor to drive the vehicle. The owner of the two-wheeler bearing number OD05 AJ1512 is one Kailash Rout.

Justifying the action, Cuttack RTO Dipti Patra said, “As per provision under Section 199 of the new Motor Vehicles Act, for offence committed by a juvenile, his or her parents will be prosecuted and fines will be imposed upon them for allowing their minor children to drive vehicles.”

Title: P’khemundi forester held taking bribe
Article:
n The Vigilance police on Tuesday caught Paralakhemundi Forest Division’s Ramagiri Range Forester Dibakar Lenka red-handed for demanding and accepting an illegal gratification of Rs 5,000.

He was caught taking the bribe from complainant Krushna Chandra Karjee of Mangarajpur village in Gajapati district in order to release his cutter saw machine and not to initiate any forest case against him.

The machine was taken away by Lenka while Karjee was cutting some trees in his own field on January 8. Lenka’s office room at Ramagiri and rented house at Sridhar Nagar in Paralakhemundi were searched. He was arrested and will be forwarded to court.

Title: Road safety week observed in Khordha
Article:
n An awareness rally was organised here to mark the beginning of the 31st National Road Safety Week from January 11 to 17.

The rally jointly organised by the RTO, Bhubaneswar and RTO, Khordha started from the Collectorate and moved throughout the city, creating awareness about traffic rules and safe driving.

A meeting was held at the Sanskruti Bhavan where MLA Jyotirindra Nath Mitr and Additional District Collector Manoranjan Mallick graced as guest and spoke on importance of road safety. RTO Bhubaneswar Pradeep Kumar Mohanty presided over the programme and talked on the theme “Be Safe-Be Happy.”

Among others, DIPRO Manas Ranjan Biswal and Adarsha Club convenor Subhranshu Ranjan Samantray spoke. While Assistant PRO Brundaban Sahoo anchored the meeting, MVI Amit Kumar Rana proposed a vote of thanks in the end.

Many school students, teachers, members of different organisations and RTO staffs participated in the rally.

Title: NZ tour: 3 from Odisha in Indian women’s team
Article:
As many as three players from Odisha have secured berth in the 20-member Indian Women’s Hockey Team for the New Zealand tour scheduled to begin on January 25 in Auckland. They are Deep Grace Ekka, Namita Toppo and Lilima Minz. The team led by Rani and vice-captained by Savita consists of Rajini Etimarpu, Deep Grace Ekka, Gurjit Kaur, Reena Khokhar, Salima Tete, Sushila Chanu, Nisha, Namita Toppo, Udita, Monika, Lilima Minz, Neha, Sonika, Sharmila Devi, Navneet Kaur, Lalremsiami, Vandana Katariya, Navjot Kaur.

While the team’s first match is against the New Zealand Development Squad on 25 January, they will play against the New Zealand Women’s Team on January 27 and 29 followed by a match against Great Britain on February 4 and then conclude the tour with another match with the New Zealand Women’s Team on February 5.

Title: MCD adds more counters due to rush
Article:
Considering the rush of people arriving at the Municipal Corporation of Dehradun (MCD) to pay property tax, the corporation added four more counters on Tuesday, a day after adding four more counters.

Now the corporation has 12 counters to service those coming to pay the property tax. On Tuesday, the MCD collected about Rs 90 lakh in property taxes while a day ago the corporation had collected about Rs 50 lakh in property taxes.

It is pertinent to mention here that the period for rebate on house tax is set to expire on Wednesday, due to which a considerable number of citizens turned out to pay their property tax in the corporation in recent days. According to the MCD tax superintendent Dharmesh Painuly, “On Monday, there was a massive crowd for the deposition of the property tax that led to the submission of Rs 50 lakh in just one day. Therefore, we have added four more counters considering the large number of people who have come to deposit property tax in the last few days.”

According to sources, Rs 50 lakh collection in a day was the highest amount collected within 24 hours by MCD till Tuesday when Rs 90 lakh was collected within a day. If the period for rebate in property tax is not extended, the property tax payers would not get 20 per cent rebate. However, the final decision regarding extension of rebate period as also demanded by members from both BJP and Congress, will be taken by the mayor Sunil Uniyal ‘Gama’ on Wednesday.

Title: Ten party workers of BJP appointed on various posts
Article:
n Ahead of the expected Cabinet expansion, ten leaders of the Bharatiya Janata Party were accorded various posts by the State Government on Tuesday.

Recently, the Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat had hinted at cabinet expansion in the near future.On Tuesday, it was revealed that 10 leaders of the Bharatiya Janata Party have been accorded various positions.

Rajvir Singh from Khatima in Udham Singh Nagar was made the chairman of Uttarakhand State Seed and Organic Produce Certification Agency, Vishwas Dawar from Dehradun has been made the chairman of Uttarakhand Housing and Development Council, Bahadur Singh Bisht from Haldwan in Nainital has been made the vice chairman-II of Uttarakhand State Higher Education Upgradation Committee, Atat Singh Aswal from Srinagar in Pauri has been made the vice chairman-I of irrigation advisory committee while Atar Singh Tomar from Chamba in Tehri has been made the vice chairman-II of the irrigation advisory committee.

Further, Shobha Ram Prajapati from Haridwar district has been made the vice chairman of Mati Kalyan Board, Fakir Ram Tamta from Berinag in Pithoragarh has been made the vice chairman of social welfare plan monitoring committee, Khempal Singh from Mothrowala in Dehradun has been made vice chairman of Pichda Varg Kalyan Parishad, Karn Bohra from Doiwala in Dehradun has been made vice chairman of Uttarakhand Van Panchayat advisory council and Sushil Chauhan from Bahadrabad in Haridwar district has been made the vice chairman of the organic produce council.

It is pertinent to mention here that recently, the chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat had said that though the vacancy of three positions in the cabinet was not affecting the works of the state government, the need for filling the vacancies was being felt.

According to observers, the appointment of party workers to various positions is likely to be followed by appointments to the three vacant positions in the state cabinet.

Title: Territorial argument escalates to violence among eunuchs
Article:
An altercation between two groups of enunchs in Roorkee regarding their territory of business turned violent, leaving two of them injured. On being informed, the police reached the site and sent the two injured to the hospital while also diffusing the altercation.

According to the information received, some eunuchs were seeking money from people in Sheikhpuri area of Roorkee under the jurisdiction of Gangnahar Kotwali area, when the eunuchs of Roorkee got information about this.

The eunuchs of Roorkee reached Sheikhpuri told the other group to not ask for money in the area stating that this was not their area of operations. Members of the other group of eunuchs allegedly started abusing their business rivals which escalated into a violent altercation between the two groups. Two eunuchs of the Roorkee group were injured in the fight.

On being informed about the disturbance, the police reached the site and pacified the members of the two groups. The two injured persons were sent to the hospital. Both the groups have submitted written complaints to the police.

The eunuch group from Roorkee has alleged that eunuchs coming from Najibabad in Uttar Pradesh are seeking money in Roorkee, while the eunuchs of Najibabad group have alleged that they live with eunuchs here and are hence seeking money from the locals. Police are currently investigating the case on the basis of complaints.

Title: NSUI holds protest over ban on mobile phones in colleges
Article:
Agitated on the recent statement of State Minister for Higher Education Dhan Singh Rawat on ban on mobile phones in the colleges, the members of the National Students Union of India (NSUI) burned the effigy of the minister on Tuesday.

The activists of the NSUI burned the effigy of the minister at DAV College here.

Addressing the NSUI workers, the state president of the NSUI, Mohan Bhandari said that decision to ban use of mobile phone is outrageous especially when most of the universities and colleges are providing free Wi -Fi to the students.

He added that in the colleges located in the mountainous areas the mobile phone helps in providing security to the students.

The minister had said on Sunday that soon mobile phones would be banned in the colleges.

He said that the decision is being taken to ensure concentration of the students in the classes. The minster also added that if need arises, low range jammers would be installed in the colleges.

Title: Search for job costs Sambalpur youth dear
Article:
He went to Bihar in search of a job with the help of his father’s friend, but returned being married forcefully.

He tolerated all torture there, got compelled to keep physical relation with the girl whom he never saw but married at the gun point. However, he managed to flee the place and reached his native place, Sambalpur. Mahammad Murshid of Kumbharpada under the Dhanupali police station had requested his friend in Darbhanga in Bihar, Wahab Basir, to find a job for his son Mahammad Samser, a 23-year- -old youth.

After some days, Wahab Basir informed his Sambalpur friend that he had searched a job for his son and requested him to send him immediately to Darbhanga.

Accordingly, Samser reached Darbhanga on December 2 last year. But situation was totally different and hostile for him there. The moment he reached his father’s friend’s house, he was beaten up mercilessly and locked up in a room with just two meals in a day.

On 11th day, he was taken to another place at the gun point and was asked to marry a girl. He was told that if he would express unwillingness, he would meet dire consequence.

After the end of the ‘forceful marriage’, he was again asked to stay with the girl and keep physical relations with her. But Samser didn’t do that; rather he tried to flee the spot at any cost and finally succeeded.

Facing a lot of hurdles on way, Samser finally reached Sambalpur recently and narrated the entire story to his father and family members. And finding no other way out, the family members lodged an FIR in the local police station.

At the same time they have also filed a case against Wahab Basir and his two sons in the court of the SDJM Sambalpur.

When contacted, IIC of Dhanupali police station Kamal Lochan Panda said, “The place of occurrence is in Bihar. Hence, a station diary has been only registered here.”

Whatever legal action would be taken, it would be done in Bihar only, he clarified.

Title: CUTM holds faculty development prog
Article:
Centurion University of Technology and Management (CUTM) Vice-Chancellor Supriya Pattanayak has opined that educators in colleges and universities should also undergo training on teaching methods like schoolteachers.

She stated this after inaugurating a two-day faculty development programme (FDP) on the topic “Enhancing Teaching Skills Using Micro Teaching Method” held at the CUTM Bhubaneswar campus recently.

The FDP, which had been designed keeping in mind the relevant guidelines of University Grants Commission, had discussion and experience sharing sessions on the challenges being faced by present day educators and learners, skills required to face these challenges and use of technology in the teaching-learning process.

During the programme, the educators had hands-on practice of modern teaching skills in small sessions, called Micro Teaching sessions. The educators also learnt how to develop and use simulations and other modern pedagogy tools to make the learning experience for the students more engaging and effective.

At total of 73 educators from 25 educational institutions of Odisha, West Bengal and Jharkhand participated. Mani resource person Bijay Bhujabal spoke on CUTM innovations in teaching and learning processes.

Title: Aitihya Parisad demands Puri declared heritage city
Article:
n The Aitihya Parisad, members took on the Centre for not declaring Puri as 'heritage city’.

While the members demanded Puri to be announced as heritage city, they also praised the State Government for its endevour of a heritage corridor here.

Parisad president Rajguru Ashok Kumar Mahapatra expressing regrets said that the city of Lord Jagannath is yet to be recognized as heritage city by the Center. "If the Center recognises Puri as such, it would attract foreign nationals to Puri in large numbers, who would be interested learn tradition and religion of global fraternity, said Mahapatra.

Joining a discussion held here, culture researcher Madanmohan Mohapatra said Puri is complete since it remains as laboratory of social pictures and cultural lives of the country.

He said that Puri is birthplace of Vedic philosophy and spiritualism which are available in all the dynasties that have passed through generation in Puri.

There are plenty of evidences available that all the dynasts have followed religious diktats of the spiritual gurus while managing the Jagannath Temple, said Mohapatra.

Joining as invitee, octogenarian citizen Pravakar Mishra said the history and heritage were two sides of the same coin which couldn't be separated. So Puri’s heritage, culture and religions are not at all myth. Nevertheless, they are a history, said Mishra requesting the State Government to protect the old monuments during development of heritage corridor around the Jagannath Temple.

Laxminarayan Patnaik coordinated the meeting.

Title: In Briefs
Article:
Khariar College, GM Varsity ink mou

Nuapada: A memorandum of understanding (MoU) on Cultural and Academic exchange was signed by the Khariar Autonomous College with the Gangadhar Meher University on Monday. The MoU was signed between Dr Harendra Kumar Panda, Principal of Khariar Autonomous College, and Prof Dr Atanu Pati, Vice-Chancellor of GM University. University Deputy Registrar Umacharan Pati was the other signatory. "It will create immense opportunity for the students to gain culturally and academically," said Prof Bishnudev Mallik of the Khariar Autonomous College.

Road safety awareness held at Bhapur

Bhapur (Nayagarh): An awareness programme was organised on the occasion of the 31st National Road Safety Week here recently in which school students of the Bhapur block took part. Students took out an awareness rally holding placards and made people aware of traffic rules for road safety. In the evening, a Led was put up in Bhapur market to create awareness among people. The Regional Transport Office and the Fategarh police have undertaken various programmes to aware people about traffic rules. Among others, Fategarh PS SI Niranjan Kishore Badjena, Sachidananda Samantray, Somnath Jena, Yoginath Behera, Nabin Kumar, Ramesh Barad and Murlidhar Swain were present.

MCL provides ambulance to D’garh Blood Bank

Sambalpur: The MCL under its CSR initiative provided an ambulance to the Deogarh district Red Cross Blood Bank. The vehicle will be used for collection of blood from interior villages of Deogarh district and adjoining districts so that the blood bank will have a reserve of ample bloods to meet the requirement of rural population. The ambulance will carry paramedical staffs to the blood donations camps and have the facility to collect blood with donor couch fitted in it so that blood donation camps can be organised in remote villages.

MCL golfers win Raibahadur Jain Trophy

Sambalpur: Golfers of Mahanadi Coalfields Limited (MCL) have won the Raibahadur Harakchand Jain Memorial Trophy at Green City Golf 2020, Ranchi. The team of Mahanadi Golf Club (MGC) included Rajatodai Singh (H-08), SK Lall (H-09), Vinayak D Jamwal (H-16) and Biradar Vijaykumar Annarao (H-18). Lall was also declared the "Best Outstation Golfer" of the tournament, which saw participation of more than 230 golfers from different parts of the country.

Title: Kalahandi Utsav ‘Ghumura' kicks off
Article:
n A four-day Kalahandi Utsav - Ghumura -2020 was inaugurated here on Tuesday. The festival aims to showcase the rich folk culture of the district.

Torch rallies were taken out from the Manikeswari temple of Thuamul Rampur, Shiva temple of Mohangiri, Budharaja temple of Ampani, Manikeswari temple of Bhawanipatna and Urladani, the soil of martyr Rindo Majhi and culminated at the venue.

Leader of Opposition Pradipta Kumar Naik inaugurated the festival in the presence of Zilla Parishad chairperson Namitarani Sahu, Narla MLA Bhupinder Singh, Dharmagarh MLA Mousudhi Bag, Lanjigarh MLA Pradeep Disari and Collector, Kalahandi, Gavali Parag Harshad.

Folk dances like Ghumura and Gotipua were performed by the artistes. Artistes from various States were scheduled to perform on the stage during the festival.

Similarly, a Palishree Mela was organised to exhibit local crafts and products by the district administration. The festival will also be celebrated at Dharamgarh from January 15 to 17.

Title: Kendrapada BJP CAA rally denied permission
Article:
n A massive public awareness rally by the BJP on CAA which was scheduled to start from Tinimuhani-based Ram Mandir to Gopa-based Raghunathjew temple covering the busy township on Tuesday, was stopped at the starting point.

According to SP Niti Sekhar, the district administration and police department earlier denied permission to the BJP activists for organizing the rally, as the police department earlier too restricted a rally that was scheduled to organise by the minority community, protesting against CAA.

About 10 platoons of police force were deployed across the township. Besides, senior police officials and armed police force were too deployed near Gyana Pitha, located 100 meter distance from Tinimuhani –based Ram Mandir, to restrict the rally. Later, the BJP activists organised a meeting at Tinimuhani chowk supporting CAA by creating public awareness among the people and migrants not to be feared about the CAA.

BJP leaders like Bhuban Mohan Jena, Alekha Jena, Dolagobinda Nayak, Bibhu Tarai, Duryodhan Sahu,Baidyanath Chattarjee, Gagan Sahu, Umakant Pattnaik and Dillip Dash participated in the Abhijan on CAA.

Title: CUO students to visit MGAHVV, Wardha
Article:
n The Central University of Odisha( CUO) is conducting a student exchange programme under Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat, a flagship programme of the Union Ministry of HRD.

Around 50 students of CUO are going to visit Mahatma Gandhi Antarrashtriya Hindi Viswavidyalaya, Wardha. VC Prof I Ramabrahmam congratulated the students and conveyed his best wishes. Under EBSB, Odisha is paired with Maharashtra and the CUO is paired with MGAHVV, Wardha.

On January 9 and 10, 50 students of CUO were selected through an audition to visit MGAHVV, Wardha for student exchange programme. The auditions were held at CUO campus at Sunabeda.

The CUO team comprising students and faculty will be visiting MGAHVV, Wardha on January 20-25. The team from MGAHVV, Wardha will be visiting CUO from February 1 to 6.

A total of 134 students had registered for the auditions. The auditions were judged by eminent cultural and literary personalities including Narayan Panda, Sudam Bisoyi, Kanhucharan Pradhan and Gouriprasad Rath. It was organized by EBSB committee of CUO comprising faculty members Dr Sourav Gupta, Nodal Officer, EBSB, Dr B K Srinivas, Dr Debabrata Panda, Mr Sanjit Kr Das, Dr Minati Sahoo and Dr Phagunath Bhoi.

Title: Doon audience divided between Chhapaak and Tanhaji
Article:
Two recently released Hindi movies - Chhapaak starring Deepika Padukone and Tanhaji starring Ajay Devgn elicited varied reactions from the viewers in Dehradun. Most of them preferred the Devgn starrer to the movie starring Padukone.

For some people, the selection of the movie was also influenced by the current political scenario.

“I always watch Deepika Padukone’s movies but after her PR stunt to support one side of the protesters in JNU, I chose Tanhaji. You cannot use something as sensitive as JNU violence to promote your movies. Besides, Tanhaji is a must watch,” said college student Chandan Bharti. Some people just want to watch good cinema. “I watched Tanhaji first day first show and then I watched Chhapaak. Both the films are based on totally different subjects and both are incredible.

Of course, Chhapaak is more emotionally draining than Tanhaji and that’s why I watched Tanhaji first,” said Divya Chaturvedi. “Though I am a big Ajay Devgn fan, I wanted to see Chhapaak as there is no Hindi film as far as I remember that explored the subject of acid-attack victims. There have been documentaries and short films but no mainstream movie. It’s a good film,” said Ekta Kumari after watching the film.

Another admirer of the film Sudhanshu Kohli added, “I have heard and seen a lot about the struggle of acid attack victims but Chhapaak really brings you close to the subject and makes you think about it.”Another movie goer Anshu Kothiyal said, “I wanted to watch Tanhaji for Saif Ali Khan.

His character is so dark and yet so charismatic. I liked his acting in Tanhaji.” Priyanka Mishra, a medical student stated, “Chhapaak gives you a firsthand experience of how an acid-attack victim is humiliated again and again by society instead of being supported and empathised with.” Adding to her friend’s statement, Geeta Kumari said, “There are unnecessary controversies surrounding the movie.

The movie is a beautiful tale of a beautiful girl who is brave, fearless and strong.

Why can’t people just watch the movie if they want to and stop judging it without even watching it?”

Title: ‘Cocktail’ party at RIMS: Ploy to tarnish Director’s image?
Article:
A set of doctors, facing heat from the Director of Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS) for practicing in private, had deliberately spread rumours about consumption of liquor at a New Year party in the premiere medical institute in a bid to tarnish the image of the institute’s Director Dr. DK Singh, RIMS faculty members said on Tuesday.

Rumours about liquor being served and consumed at a New Year party in the administrative building of the hospital had hogged media attention lately. Some pictures of the party also surfaced on social media, with captions slamming the administration for violating rules.

“The news was planted. It was a deliberate attempt to tarnish the image of the Director in a bid to get him ousted from the top position in the medical college,” said a doctor, who had attended the party. “Dr. DK Singh has tightened the noose around such doctors who practice in private. They want him (Singh) to land in soup, so their private practice continues unabated,” he added.

Singh rubbished the allegations of liquor being served at the party, and seconded the aforementioned faculty member.

“The allegations are baseless. Some people cannot handle discipline and action against their corrupt practices. They are trying to tarnish the image of the institute to get away with their practice of seeing patients in private and making extra bucks,” said Singh.

In the past one week, RIMS administration has found itself in the crosshairs of media, social activists and health professionals. A picture of a woman patient eating raw pigeon in the hospital also did the rounds on the internet. “The doctors who are facing heat from the Director are repeatedly trying to come up with some or the other reason to question his efficiency and credibility,” said another RIMS faculty member who did not wish to be named.

Singh’s ways of ensuring discipline among doctors has not gone down well with many senior doctors here. Many of them threatened to take mass voluntary retirement last year citing his alleged dictatorial rules as a reason.

The doctors were been asked to report at 9 am and work till 5 pm – a decision that made the doctors see red. The hospital’s administration also shot showcause notices to doctors who practiced in private.

Lately, the RIMS administration conducted raids at establishments where the doctors ran private practice – a development that has left many doctors complaining. Singh had also warned the doctors that if they are caught practicing in private, they might have to lose their job.

Title: Power cuts hit life
Article:
Power failure has affected many areas of the State capital, including the VIP localities such as Kanke Road, in the past few days. However, the Jharkhand Bijli Vitaran Nigam Limited (JBVNL) has denied any major lapses in the supply system, claiming that the power supply was obstructed only on Tuesday due to maintenance in Hatia Grid 2.

“The Hatia Grid 2 was under maintenance from morning till 5pm on Tuesday. This affected power supply in areas such as Kanke Road and some other localities,” said MP Yadav, Public Relations Officer of JBVNL. “No major lapses were reported in the past one week. Isolated glitches may have causes power failure in some localities,” he added.

However, there was a striking contrast between the JBVNL’s take on power supply situation and the reactions of Ranchi-ites. “There was no electricity supply for several hours on Friday and Saturday. Our area suffered from a power failure from around 9am till 2pm,” said Rekha Tripathi, a resident of Jawaharnagar in Ranchi.

Poor electricity supply also haunted residents of Upper Bazaar – the commercial hub of Ranchi – in the past one week or so. Many residents and shopkeepers in the area had to rely on generators and invertors as hours of power crisis, mostly during the day, disrupted life. “There was no power supply from 7am to 11.30am today (Tuesday). The problem is becoming bad to worse by the day,” said Subhash Kumar, a resident of Upper Bazaar.

Other busy residential areas such as Ratu Road, Morhabadi, Harmu and Ashok Nagar also faced major power crisis on Tuesday, residents said. Vaibhav Vishal Singh, a city-based professional who stays at Ashok Nagar, said that intermittent electricity supply has forced him and his parents to rely on generators even during the day. “Such poor electricity supply is not acceptable at any cost,” he said.

Power failures also affected many residential areas during the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday. Residents of Kanke Road, Morhabadi, Idalhatu, Harmu, Ratu Road and parts of Argora had to suffer in absence of electricity in the night. Usually, power failures hit the city during summers due to the additional burden of air conditioners. The untimely and unexpected power crisis during winter has become a cause for concern among residents here.

Title: Winter rain hikes vegetable prices
Article:
The price of vegetables has increased in the State as per the vegetable vendors. Winter rain in early January has caused such inflation due to which the vendors are facing trouble. The downpour has brought supply crunch across the market. Vegetable prices are heating up and are weighing high on customers’ wallet.

The commonly used vegetables such as potato is being sold at Rs 25- 30/ kg as per market rate, which was Rs 10-15/ kg last year during the same period. As far as the price of onion is concerned it is Rs 50/kg as per now which was Rs 120 few days back.

“Rains in early January in Jharkhand and elsewhere have affected the prices of cabbage, tomatoes and radish. Edible oils and Pulses are also affected by the price. Customers are buying half the quantity than the regular purchase,” said Mehmood, a vegetable vendor.

“The price of vegetables has gone high and it is quite difficult for us to increase the sale. We cultivated these veggies in our village in Pithoria. As per now the price of cabbage is Rs 30/kg, Radish Rs 10/ kg,” said Chandranath Sahu, a vegetable vendor near Nagababa Khatal.

“Vegetables such as carrot, cauliflower and cabbage are Rs 30/kg, Rs 40/kg and Rs 30/kg respectively, which is comparatively higher than the last year. It is quite difficult to manage with overall budget of the family,” said Neelema, customer at the vegetable shop.

“Leafy vegetables such as lettuce, parsley, celery, basil, are Rs 300 - 500 per kg and are exported and hence costly. Other than this capsicum and peas are attaining a height of Rs 50 and Rs 40 respectively,” said Arvind Oraon, retail owner of vegetable shop.

According to the traders, early vegetables got damaged due to rains. As the prices of most of the vegetables are high, consumption has not yet gone down.

Title: In briefs
Article:
Centralised loan branch of CBI

A centralized loan processing branch of Central Bank of India will be inaugurated at Krishna Arcade a, Dipatoli on Wednesday. With this home, educational and mortgage based loans will now be processed through one branch. The main objective of launching this branch is to speed up the process of retail loan and also for the convenience of customers.

TW0 students win prizes in spelling contest

Two students of Taurian World School, bagged prizes at the mega final at the Wiz National Spell Bee contest held in Delhi on December 29, 2019. Malak Hassan Khan of class V got the 25th rank while Atharv Jhawar of class II came 30th. They are the only students from Jharkhand to make it to the top 30 out of 350 students who qualified for the mega finale from all across India.

Toyota opens bookings for Innova Crysta

Toyota Kirloskar Motor (TKM), has opened bookings for the BS-VI compliant version of its flagship MPV, Innova Crysta. The petrol and diesel variants of the BS-VI compliant Innova Crysta will be available in both Manual as well as Automatic Transmission options. Launched in 2016, the Innova Crysta has been the undisputed leader in the MPV segment known for its luxurious features, comfort, safety, powerful performance, low maintenance and high resale value, delivering Toyotas legendary promise of Quality, Durability and Reliability (QDR).

Title: City girl crowned best makeup artist at Golden Wings Award
Article:
Ranchiites are making their mark all over the world be it in the films, fashion industry, social work or any other profession. One such example is of city based 32- year old Priyanka Jaiswal, who has won accolades for her work as a makeup artist.

Jaiswal was adjudged as the Best Makeup Artist at Golden Wings Award on January 5 in New Delhi while competing with about 40 other participants.

“I was asked to recreate Deepika Padukone’s wedding look on my model in a time span of two hours. Right from doing her makeup to setting her hair and draping her outfit, what generally takes three to four hours, had to be done in almost half the time. The judgment was on the basis of how close one is in recreating the actual look,” said the beautician.

Starting her career as a city based makeup artist in December 2017, Jaiwal- a freelance beautician in a short span has dolled up about 300 women so far. She charges something between Rs 3,000 to Rs 15,000 for bridal and party wear makeup.

From her younger days Jaiswal has always been a very creative person and would love to play dress up. She even did a diploma course in beauty science from Vedaansh School of Art and School in Ranchi after her 10th boards.

“While I was growing up, women in my family would not use too much makeup owing to their healthy and flawless skin. But from the beginning I always wanted to wear makeup when going out and also did a course in beauty science just for myself. I had very thought of making a profession out of it, that just happened by chance,” recalls the makeup artist.

Always focusing on academics, there was also a point when Jaiswal was keen to take the UPSC exams and had also worked as a teacher in local playschool for a couple of years. But destiny had something else in store for her.

“While chatting with a school friend, I just happened to mention preparing for competitive exams which not just shocked her but also made me realize that my potential lies in something else,” said Jaiswal.

Jaiswal then did a basic to advanced course from Babli Jaiswal in Kolkata followed by a master class from Amit Kumar, a renowned makeup and hairstylist based in Delhi. She has attended a transformation tour master class under Goar Avetisyan from Moscow in Delhi.

“Even before I started doing it professionally I would always look up to Meenaksho Dutta in Nagpur and follow her You Tube tutorials. Recently, I got an opportunity to attend her master class and it was nothing less than a dream come true for me,” said an ecstatic Jaiswal.

Born and brought up in Ranchi, Jaiswal is a resident of Ratu Road and did her schooling from Bishop Westcott Girls School and later from Cambrian Public School. She holds a post graduate degree in Masters in Commerce with Accounts honours from Doranda College.

“Juggling between my professions and managing my family is definitely a challenge. Being a freelance makeup artist, my work makes a travel to nearby places. I make it a point to spend time with my husband and daughter as much as possible. It was my husband who pushed me to start my own business and both my mother and mother in- law are immensely supportive,” she added. Her husband Abhishek Prasad is in a private job in Ranchi.

Title: CS fiat to complete works of Kanhar Barrage in time
Article:
Chief Secretary Dr DK Tiwari has instructed to expedite the works for Kanhar Barrage meant for irrigation of farm land in Garhwa and Palamu district of the State. Reviewing the works of the project here on Tuesday the CS fixed time limit of all preliminary works of the barrage and instructed the officials to execute the works in the set time frame.

At the same time, the Chief Engineers of Water Resources Department of Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand were instructed to jointly clarify the ownership status of the land on the border of the two states by February 28 and submit a joint report.

Notably, Jharkhand is considering 58.01 hectares of land attached to the project with Chhattisgarh, but Chhattisgarh says that this land is 79.55 hectares. The actual status land on the boundary line is not clear and that is why project work is not progressing as expected.

The Kanhar Barrage project would require a total of 1,019 hectares of land in Palamu and Garhwa districts. Out of that, the actual location of 866.62 hectares has been known. During the review, the Deputy Commissioners of both the districts stated that the nature of 90 plots of the marked land is yet to be clear. The Chief Secretary directed the Deputy Commissioners to clarify the condition of the entire land by February 3.

At the same time, clarifying the nature of the land, the forest department was directed to make the land available for forest clearance online. The Water Resources Department and the Forest Department were instructed to complete the work of marking the trees on the land related to forest clearance by April 30.

The farmers of Garhwa district will get the most benefit from the construction of a barrage on the Kanhar River entering Chhattisgarh from Jharkhand. There is a plan to irrigate the fields of Bhawanathpur, Bishunpur, Chinia, Dandai, Dhurki, Garhwa, Kandi, Ketar, Majhiyan, Meral, Nagar Untari, Ramna, Ranka and Chainpur blocks of Palamu with barrage water in Garhwa.

Additional Chief Secretary Arun Kumar Singh, Chief Engineers of Water Resources department of Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand alongwith senior officials were present on the occasion.

Title: Sisodia: BJP will stop AAP freebies if it wins
Article:
Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and senior AAP leader Manish Sisodia on Tuesday launched a scathing attack on the BJP over economic slowdown and retail inflation, which is at a five-and-a-half-year high, saying that each vote cast for the saffron party in the Delhi polls will be for inflation.

Sisodia said a vote for the BJP will mean a vote for expensive electricity, education, health and public transport. "The BJP is a party that will make everything expensive if voted to power. They will stop all the free welfare schemes introduced by AAP Government and impose huge financial burdens on the people of Delhi," he said.

He said that mismanagement of the economy has made it difficult for people to run their households and the only relief is provided to them by the AAP Government's welfare schemes.

Quoting figures released by NSSO on inflation, he said people are worrying not just from the perspective of economic slowdown or unemployment but because it has become difficult for the common man to sustain even basic household expenses. "This is BJP's gift to people in the last 6 years. Prices of essential commodities have been constantly rising since the BJP came to power as inflation increased from 2.1 per cent to 7.4 per cent in just one year and the prices of vegetables increased by 60 per cent across the nation in just one year," he added.

He further said that even in the face of these troubling statistics, BJP leaders are busy making statements which are akin to applying salt to wounds. "On the one hand, the Delhi Government is sustaining people's lives by subsidizing electricity, public transport, school fees and health services without which they would have found it difficult to survive and on the other hand, BJP has been proclaiming that all these facilities shouldn't be given for free and that they are against subsidies," he added.

Sisodia said "BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma said that if the BJP comes to power in Delhi, they will stop all subsidies. I want to ask the BJP- what exactly is their problem? Kejriwal's Government is doing all to provide relief to people. We will keep continuing subsidy after coming back to power," he said.

Title: Check encroachment area in all squares: Min
Article:
Drive out stray animals, pigs and dogs from the city. Take stern action against those who interrupt this work. Arrange a team from outside to catch monkeys in urban area. This was said by the Minister for Energy Priyavrat Singh at the District Planning Committee meeting held in Jabalpur, the district of his charge.

Singh directed to remove all encroachment soon from the left turn of the all the squares of the city. Cameras should also be installed at the squares. He further instructed to complete all the preparations within the stipulated time for Narmada Kumbh to be held at Gwarighat. Singh said that gou-shalas should also be connected with economic activities. Make a plan for constructing a big gou-shala in Hirapur Bandha village, he added.

Energy Minister told to ensure availability of sufficient bags at procurement centers for procurement of paddy. Address the grievances of farmers at the centers expeditiously. He further told to pay special attention that paddy should be purchased from the eligible farmers only at the procurement centers. Singh said that under the Jai Kisan Loan Waiver Scheme, one more opportunity has been given to apply for loan waiver in pink farm by January 31. He said that this decision should be widely publicized. Singh also reviewed the other schemes and gave necessary instructions in the meeting.

Minister for Finance Tarun Bhanot said that construction of underground sewerage system should be completed within stipulated time. He told for developing an identified place in Tevar for the persons displaced from Madan Mahal Hill.

The Minister for Social Justice Lakhan Ghanghoriya directed to expedite the work of storm water drainage system.

Mayor Swati Godbole, District Panchayat Chairperson Manorama Patel, MLAs Ajay Vishnoi, Vinay Saxena and Sanjay Yadav besides other members of District Planning Committee were present at the meeting.

Title: 6 infants die in 12 hours, MP Govt initiates probe
Article:
The Shahdol district in Madhya Pradesh has reported six deaths of new-born kids in last 12 hours, prompting the State Government to initiate a probe.

On Monday night, four infants admitted at the Special Newborn Care Unit (SNCU) of district hospital Shahdol died. With this, the State Government run hospital has witnessed deaths of six new-born kids in last 12 hours.

The hospital has only conveyed to the media that the kids died out of Pneumonia. Those died included Chauth Kumari from Jaitpur block who died on Jan 13, Phoolmati Singh from Jaisingnagar block, Shyam Narayan Kol from Amiliha and Suraj Baiga a native of village Pania.Admitted to Paediatrics ward, Anjali Baiga and another kid too have died out of Pneumonia. These fatalities have sent the health machinery in the State into a tizzy.The SNCU in charge Dr Sunil Hathgel was quoted by local media as saying that the four infants were brought to the hospital in critical condition, still the hospital tried its best to save them. Two other infants suffering Pneumonia too have died in the general ward of the hospital.

Public Health and Family Welfare Minister Tulsiram Silawat has taken cognizance of these mortalities and have ordered the district collector and Chief Medical and Health Officer to probe into the deaths of infants, a State Government statement said.

The Minister has expressed solidarity with the bereaved families, it added. Panchayat and Rural Development minister Kamleshwar Patel who hails to nearby Sidhi district also rushed to Shahdol and visited the district hospital on Tuesday.

Title: BJP’s Pragya Thakur receives suspicious letter with powder
Article:
Bharatiya Janata Party Bhopal Member of Parliament Pragya Thakur on Monday evening allegedly received a letter scripted in Urdu which contained suspicious powder.

The letter was delivered in the month of Oct but the BJP MP had opened it on Monday night. Upon opening the envelope, Thakur received a letter and a powder sachet inside.

In a complaint the police, she alleged that after touching suspicious powder she developed skin allergy. On her complaint Bhopal police lodged a case against unknown person under sections 326 and 506 of the IPC late night on Mon.

Additional Superintendent of Police Akhil Patel told the media that the envelope received in October was opened late evening. It had a suspicious powder weighing around 20 gram. The officer said that it wasn't clear what kind of powder it was and was handed over to FSL experts.

The letter also had some threatening words against MP in Urdu language, said the officer reading that the security of the BJP MP is being enhanced.

Talking to media persons, Thakur said that a conspiracy is being hatched against her adding her life was under threat. The envelope carried her photograph with a cross sign on it, claimed Thakur.

Thakur claimed of having received such threatening letters in past that did not do anything on her repeated complaints.

Title: Tigress on prowl, kills Ox at jungle in Galudih
Article:
The suspected tigress that reportedly killed an ox and injuring a cow at Dainmari jungle in Galudih three days ago killed another ox at Basadera jungle in Galudih on Monday evening.

With another cattle killed at the dense Basadera jungle adjoining Dainmari jungle, it is evident that the tigress which had sneaked into Galudih in Ghatshila sub-division is very much that forest cover.

Divisional forest officer, Jamshedpur, Abhishek Kumar said the killing of yet another cattle took place on Monday.

"We have gathered information that the residents of Basadera village had heard the scream of a cattle. Panic gripped villagers had contacted forest guards who discovered the carcass of the ox lying at about half-kilometre-away from Dharagiri fall and about one-an-half kms away from the Basadera village," said Kumar .

The DFO informed that a team of 20 forest guards carried out an operation and ultimately discovered the carcass.

The fatal wound was in the neck of the ox and it appeared that the tigress had attacked.

The senior forest officer pointed out that with a fresh instance of killing by the tigress, the department has to keep strict vigil.

Title: Ansari considers himself spokesperson of Bangaldeshi infiltrators: Shahdeo
Article:
State BJP Spokesperson Pratul Shahdeo termed Congress MLA Irfan Ansari's statement as extremely objectionable and embarrassing, in which he had made derogatory remarks about the Prime Minister.

Shahdeo said that the Prime Minister is the Prime Minister of the whole country and not of any particular party. Irfan Ansari has exposed his political culture by making petty remarks on a personal level. He said that Irfan Ansari also comes from a party, which has been known to do politics of appeasement. Earlier, Irfan Ansari has also made unwarranted allegations against nationalist ideological organizations like RSS to appease minority votes.

Pratul said that it seems that Irfan Ansari has started to understand himself less as an MLA and more as a spokesman for Bangladeshi infiltrators. He said that politics has its place, but when you make a poor and low level personal accusation on the Prime Minister of the country, it becomes clear that either your mental state is not good or you are deliberately doing it for appeasement. “This time, he has crossed all limits. Actually, Irfan Ansari makes such statements to please a few contractors of religion. The Congress high command has not shied away from this statement of Irfan Ansari and has shown his right face to the public,” he added.

Title: JVM merger likely with BJP after Jan 16
Article:
The final decision on Babulal Marandi’s party Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (JVM) merger with BJP will be taken after January 16, once Marandi returns the State Capital. Marandi after coming back will first constitute the dissolved State working committee electing new office bearers and members.

Sources said that the constituting of new working committee will gain importance as majority of new members elected on the consent of Marandi, will back his decision to merge party with BJP. Sources said that once party working committee decides to go with party chief Marandi’s decision to merge with BJP, merger will automatically occur even though party MLAs are opposed to working committee decision.

A senior JVM (P) leader requesting anonymity said, “Once working committee decides to merge the party with the consent of Marandi there will be no obstructions. The second stage is merger of party in House. If any two MLAs either Pardeep Yadav or Bandhu Tirkey decides to go with Marandi the merger of party in House too will be done smoothly, however, if two MLAs decides to go against than also Marandi will go ahead with the decision and will announce to quit the membership of House.”

The JVM leader’s statement assumes importance, as in 2006, Marandi resigned from both Kodarma (Lok Sabha constituency) seat and the primary membership of Bharatiya Janata Party in 2006 floating Jharkhand Vikas Morcha (P).

Sources said that if two MLAs decide to go against Marandi’s views as anti-party activist the two MLAs will dismissed from party and these two will act as independent MLAs.

Sources said that Marandi is very much interested to join BJP after he came to know that two of these MLAs (Yadav and Tirkey) were planning to join Congress. Both Yadav and Tirkey have openly opposed the merger of JVM with BJP. Few days back, Tirkey had said that he will never join BJP as his politics revolves around opposing BJP and will never join BJP at any cost.

Sources said that it will be win-win situation for both BJP and Marandi, as after the Assembly election debacle, BJP has been looking for a tribal face in Jharkhand with an appeal in Santhal region. Sources said that for Marandi too it will be rehabilitation for him as despite all efforts his party managed to win only three seats. The JVM (P) in the just concluded Assembly election won Dhanwar, Poraiyahat and Mandar seats, but in later two seats personnel charisma of candidate was more important than the party which they belong.

Marandi is a former RSS leader who resigned from his job as a teacher to work for the organisation. In 2000, he became the first chief minister of newly created State of Jharkhand. But, he had to resign in 2003 and Arjun Munda became the chief minister. In 2006, Marandi formed his own party and since then he has been trying to find a base in the State.

In 2009, his party won eleven Assembly seats, which were reduced to eight in 2014. In 2019, his party managed to win only three seats.

Title: 11 members of Aman Srivastava gang held
Article:
Eleven members of notorious gangster Aman Srivastava’s gang synonymous with terror in Kolanchal were arrested by a joint team of Latehar police along with Ranchi, Hazaribagh and Chatra police on Tuesday. The arrested criminals include Mukesh Kumar Saw, Mahmood Mian, Mahmood Alam, Razak Ansari, Saurabh Sinha, Amarjeet Paswan, Kurban Ansari, Sudarshan Nayak Rajesh Kumar Mishra, Sanjay Ganjhu and Ankit Kishore Nath Sahi.

The police recovered four country made pistols, three cartridges and 60 rounds of live bullets and other items from the arrested criminals. According to police the arrested criminals Mukesh Kumar, Mahmood Mian, Mahmood Alam and Rajesh Kumar have criminal history.

Sources said that for past few months, gangster Aman Srivastava was active in Latehar and border districts involved in various criminal incidents such as extortion from coal traders and contractors, murder, arson and firing incidents. The DIG South Chotanagpur Ranchi to check the activities of Aman Srivastava gang had constituted a special team headed by Latehar Superintendent of Police (SP).

The police team on Tuesday arrested gang member Mukesh Saw from Balumath who later disclosed the name of other gang members. The raiding team later arrested all the criminals near the Viratoli Coal Siding and Kali Maidan in the Chandwa police station area. The police team is conducting raids to nab gang leader Aman Srivastava and the remaining members of gang.

Aman Srivastava gang is involved in different criminal incidents including kidnapping of a contractor engaged in construction of Barhi four lane road from Hazaribagh in 2018.

Apart from this, the gang was also involved in giving threat call to coal union leader Sona Ram Manjhi of New Birsa Colliery in 2019, firing on another trade union leader Dasai Manjhi in 2019 among others.

Ramgarh, Lohardaga, Latehar, Chatra and Ranchi districts of the state were after Aman Srivastava gang as in past few years his criminal activities had gone up. This gang used to collect extortion from businessmen associated with railway siding.

Title: CM instructs to treat patients with empathy
Article:
Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Tuesday expressed anguish over the complaints of lackadaisical approach of Government hospitals in treating patients. He said in clear words that the authorities should focus on solving issues rather than shrugging off their responsibilities. “Procrastinating attitude will not be tolerated at any cost,” he said.

The CM was made aware through a Tweet that one 60-year-old Shatrugn Sao, a resident of Bihar, had met with a road accident resulting in fracture of his left thigh. After the accident he was admitted to Sadar Hospital Koderma, but the hospital management rather than giving priority to his treatment kept waiting for his family members.

Expressing displeasure over the incident, Chief Minister Hemant Soren directed to treat patients sensitively in all hospitals of the State. He said that it is the responsibility of the police to find out and contact family members in unknown cases and the doctors should focus their attention on the best treatment of every patient.

The Chief Minister has directed the Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences management to ensure better treatment of Shatrughan Sawah at RIMS. The Chief Minister has asked the Deputy Commissioner of Ranchi to make arrangements for sending the patient to his ancestral residence in Bihar after treatment.

Title: AAP failed to spend 46% education Budget: Cong
Article:
Delhi Congress president Subhash Chopra on Tuesday released a "Postmortem Report" on education model of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Government, saying that 46 per cent of education Budget has remained unspent by the Government.

Addressing the media, Chopra said that if the Delhi Government education model was applied in other States, then there too students will start leaving Government schools in hordes."Over lakh of children left Government schools in Delhi due to deteriorating standard of education in past four years. Illiteracy rate in Delhi has increased from 1.7 per cent to 3.4 per cent which clearly proves the declining standard of education in the Capital, which is very shameful," he said.

Former Congress minister Arvinder Singh Lovely said that when Congress came to power, the budget for education was Rs 866 crores which was raised to Rs 5,912 crore when Congress demitted power. "The education budget of the Kejriwal Government went up to Rs 26,577 Cr but out of this amount, only Rs 12,243.06 Cr has been spent in last five years," he said, adding that this is clearly exposes that the Kejriwal Government's achievements were confined only in newspaper advertisements to mislead the people.

Lovely alleged that the number of EWS students has come down from 25,000 to 19879. He said that during the Congress regime, 1,40,534 students studied in 12th Class, and the number has now come down to 1,14,176, which 18.75 per cent reduction.

Congress Spokesperson Mukesh Sharma slammed the Kejriwal Government for not filling the 500 vacant posts of principals in Government schools. "The AAP Government did nothing for sports in Delhi though when Congress was in power, 15 new sports complexes and 14 new swimming pools were constructed, besides opening coaching centres in 140 schools. But all these facilities have been shut down by the Kejriwal Government.

Title: 3 hurt in G’gram’s Lohri celebration shooting, 1 held
Article:
Three persons sustained bullet injuries after five men gatecrashed a Lohri celebration at Sector 40 in Gurugram late on Monday night and opened indiscriminate fire on the crowd upon being confronted. One of the accused has been arrested, the police said on Tuesday.

Chander Mohan, the deputy commissioner of police (East), said that all the suspects have been identified, and the four absconding culprits will be arrested soon.

"The accused gatecrashed the Lohri function upon hearing the music being played by the DJ. After entering the function venue they spotted a bar that was set up near the gate. They were already in an inebriated state and wanted to enjoy liquor and food and got angry after a verbal spat when the residents questioned them," he said.

The arrested accused has been identified as Jai Narayan (28) of Madya Pradesh. He was arrested in April 2017 for a daylight heist at Mannapuram gold Finance branch in Gurugram. He has served four jail terms and was released on bail last December.

The probe team has recovered a pistol, two live cartridges and a Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) from the accused.

According to the police, the incident took place at around 11 pm, when Ajay Vats, a resident of Sector- 40, and his family were hosting a party, attended by "85 friends, relatives and neighbours".

The complainant, Ajay Vats, stated in his complaint that the accused arrived in a white Scorpio car and entered the function hosted by him for his friends and relatives at around 11 p.m.

The accused asked the photographer to click their pictures and one of them picked up a bottle from the drinks table. At this, Vats accosted the young man and asked him about his identity. The young man, however, pushed him off and tried to escape. But Vats' brother Vinay caught him.

"One of the accomplices of the young man took out a pistol and allegedly fired two shots, hitting Vinay Vats in his right shoulder and right hand. Surrounded by the guests, the five, in a bid to escape, and then opened indiscriminate fire hitting Pawan and Vineet Chopra," Vats stated in his police complaint.

While Vinay Vats sustained two bullet injuries, Pawan and Vineet were hit in their legs. Pawan is a resident of Sector 47 and Vineet stays in South City Phase - 1.

The accused then drove towards another Lohri function being organised in the area. Finding the way blocked, they made a U-turn and rammed into a reversing car, in which the complainant was taking his brother to the hospital. Following this, they accused sped away.

"Of the three injured, one has been discharged from the hospital while the remaining two are undergoing treatment and both are out of danger," said Inspector Pawan Kumar, Station House Officer (SHO) of the Sector 40 police station.

A case under sections 148 (unlawful assembly), 149 (common objective), 307 (attempt to murder), 427 (causing damage), 452 (trespassing) and several sections of the Arms Act was registered at the Sector 40 police station.

Title: Tenders floated for construction of 3 stations
Article:
The construction of the Rapid Rail (Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut) in the sections of national Capital has gathered speed as the implementing agency National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) has floated tenders for the construction of the three stations — New Ashok Nagar, Sarai Kale Khan and Anand Vihar — falling in the city.

The three stations will be the first Rapid Rail stations to be constructed in Delhi. Also, these stations will be heart (transport hub) of all the corridors as it will provide interconnections to all the corridors including Inter State Bus terminals (ISBT), Metro stations and connectivity to airport.

The civil construction work has already started and is underway on the 17km long priority section between Sahibabad to Duhai of 82 km long Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut Rapid Rail Transit System (RRTS) corridor.

According to officials, NCRTC has floated various tenders for the three priority sections of Delhi. In January, the bids has been invited for carrying out road widening work from New Ashok Nagar to Kondli Bridge for the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut RRTS Corridor. "Road widening work is carried out to maintain a smooth flow of traffic even during construction barricading. People will have an extra lane once barricading is removed post-construction," said an official.

It has also started the work of the engagement of Detailed Design Consultant (DDC) for Sarai Kale Khan and New Ashok Nagar RRTS stations including a Multimodal Integration scheme and setting up a stabling yard at Jungpura.

Bids have also been invited for carrying out initial pile load tests in the Delhi section from Sarai Kale Khan to Anand Vihar and connecting line to stabling Yard at Jungpura. The pile load test is done to check the load-bearing capacity of the soil.

Tenders have also been invited for design and construction of tunnels of Delhi portion by Tunnel Boring Machine from New Ashok Nagar Ramp, New Delhi to Sahibabad Ramp in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh (UP).

Officials said that the construction of underground line is a time-consuming process. "NCRTC is committed for timely completion of the project by taking various measures including early completion of the tender process."

It has floated another tender for the construction of depot cum workshop near Duhai RRTS Station of the corridor. Depot is an essential requirement for running RRTS services.

Further, the officials added, around 11.53 km stretch of the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut RRTS corridor will be underground in which 5.8 km long section will start from New Ashok Nagar RRTS station (Elevated) to stretch before BEL, Ghaziabad will be underground. While, the remaining 5.73km long section after Brahmapuri Meerut Metro Station (Elevated) to Begumpul RRTS station (before MES Colony Metro Station -Elevated) will be underground.

Title: Cold winds from hills bring mercury down
Article:
The national capital witnessed a drop in the maximum temperatures on Tuesday due to cold winds blowing in from the hills, the weather department said.

The city recorded a low of 10.5 degrees Celsius, three notches above the normal, and a maximum of 17.7 degrees Celsius, two degrees below the normal for this time of the year, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

The maximum temperature dropped by more than two degrees compared to Monday.

It is expected to be partly cloudy on Wednesday and moderate to dense fog is likely in the morning. The maximum and minimum temperatures will hover around 18 and 7 degrees Celsius respectively, the weather office said.

Experts said another spell of rain is likely in Delhi on January 16 and 17 due to a fresh Western Disturbance. Intense rain is likely on January 16, they added.

There was a slight decrease in pollution levels in the national capital due to favourable wind speed and the AQI was recorded at 283 in the 'poor' category. The AQI was recorded at 366 on Monday. A significant improvement in the air quality is expected only after rains on January 16.

Title: Cong sees larger conspiracy behind Davinder arrest
Article:
In the wake of arrest of Jammu & Kashmir DSP Davinder Singh, Congress on Tuesday stated that question will certainly be raised as to who were the real culprits behind the gruesome Pulwama incident and which now needs a fresh look on it.

“There is a larger conspiracy behind Davinder Singh's arrest. We demand the Prime Minister and the Home Minister to order a thorough probe,” Congress said. The party said now, the question will arise who were the real culprits behind the Pulwama attack. The terror strike in Jammu & Kashmir's Pulwama had left 40 CRPF personnel dead on February 14 last year.

The Opposition party claimed that Singh “cannot be a stand alone carrier”, with the Congress' leader in LoK Sabha, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, saying the question will now arise who were the real culprits behind the last year Pulwama attack.

Taking a swipe at the RSS, Chowdhury said had police officer Davinder Singh been “Davinder Khan”, the reaction of the “troll regiment of the RSS” would have been different.

Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said, “There is a larger conspiracy. At whose instance was Davinder Singh acting and bringing terrorists to Delhi, as reported.” “Are there any people who are in the echelons of power who are involved with him (Singh). Is there a larger conspiracy? Is he only a pawn or a carrier in the larger conspiracy that is unleashed?” he asked.
